Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy used and new clothing. Since joining Finca, Patricia has learned to invest her money and now her financial situation has improved. Patricia's dream is to have a set locale for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, cette dame est divorcée de son mari et à 02 enfants, afin de satisfaire convenablement aux charges de ses enfants, elle a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique qu’elle appelle « BETHESDA » elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Elle a déjà obtenu successivement deux crédits de WAGES qui lui ont permis d’installer son commerce, elle demande un troisième crédit qui lui permettra de réapprovisionner sa boutique en produits  d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
A resident of the Adidogomé district, this is a woman who is divorced and has two children. To support her children appropriately, she started doing commerce in grocery items in her shop she calls “Bethesda”. She acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She obtained two successive loans from WAGES before. These loans enabled her to establish her commerce. She’s asking for a third loan allowing her to stock up again with grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general supplies for her shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es socio del Banco Comunal La Paz, Juan vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juan es casado, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, Juan es maestro constructor y realiza trabajos de construcción en diferentes lugares, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personales.
Juan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción.
Juan sueña con ahorrar lo suficiente para la vejez y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Juan lives in the community of Yanama which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Juan is married; he is 44 years old and has six children. Juan is a master builder and builds in different areas, work which he is able to do with the help of his employees. Juan needs a loan of 1000 soles with which he will buy building materials. Juan dreams of saving enough for his old age and of giving his children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Viviana vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Viviana es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Viviana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cereales y para el tarrajeo de su casa.
Los sueños de Viviana son construir su casa, surtir y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Viviana belongs to the "La Paz" community bank. She lives in the community of Yanama which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Viviana is married; she is 40 years old and has four children. Viviana has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, wood. Her store is open seven days a week. Viviana needs a loan of 1,500 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, cereals as well as to plaster the walls of her home. Viviana dreams of building her home, stocking and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cereals as well as to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Afi Delali

texts.fr: A. delali a commencé en 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois, avant elle  était la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier, elle réalisait de bon chiffre d’affaire mais actuellement d’autres femmes ont commencé ce commerce, voulant surmonter cette concurrence et regagner la confiance de ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de charbons de bois.  Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2004, A. Delali started doing commerce in charcoal. In the past, she was the only one in this business in her district. She used to realize good sale figures. But right now, other women have started in this business. Wanting to overcome this competition and to regain the trust of her customers, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES, so as to increase her stock of charcoal. She is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Angelina vive en la comunidad D. Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Angelina es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Angelina viaja a los diferentes pueblos y ferias D. donD. compra cereales, quesos, productos que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Angelina venD. leña en su casa.
Angelina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña, queso.
Los sueños D. Angelina son mejorar su negocio, tener ahorros y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Angelina is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. She lives in the community of Yanama located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Angelina is married; she is 52 years old and has two children. Angelina travels to different villages and markets where she buys cereals, cheese, products which she then sells in the city of Ayacucho. Angelina also sells firewood from her home. Angelina needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy firewood and cheese. Angelina dreams of improving her business, having savings set asiD. and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and cheese

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Haydee vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Haydee tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, frutas. Además Haydee vende comida actividad que realiza todos los días.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, harina, azúcar y aceite.
Haydee sueña con aumentar su negocio, educar a sus hijos y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.
texts.en:
Haydee belongs to the "La Paz" community bank. Haydee lives in the community of Yanama which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Haydee is married common-law. She is 33 years old and has four children. Haydee has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables, meat and fruit. Haydee also sells prepared food daily. Haydee needs a loan of 1,500 soles to buy rice, flour, sugar and oil. Haydee dreams of increasing her business, educating her children and saving enough for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Amelia vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Amelia es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Amelia se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la puerta del colegio de su comunidad. Además Amelia los días sábados prepara comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Amelia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y galletas.
Los sueños de Amelia son tener un negocio grande, surtido y ahorrar lo suficiente para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Amelia lives in the community of Yanama which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Amelia is married; she is 30 years old and has three children. Amelia sells candies at the entryway of her local high school. In addition to this business, Amelia cooks food on Saturdays with her husband's help. Amelia needs a loan of 900 soles to buy soft drinks and cookies. Amelia dreams of having a large store, well-stocked and of saving enough money for her children..

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cookies

loans.name: Licet

texts.es:
Licet es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad.
Licet es separada, tiene 39 años y 1 hija, Liset vende ropa de niños por mayor y menor, reparte a las tiendas, galerías y también en un local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Licet necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
Licet sueña con tener una tienda, local propio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Licet is a member of the "Generosidad" community bank. Licet is separated; she is 39 years old and has one daughter. Licet sells children's clothing both wholesale and retail; she delivers to stores, malls as well as to a location in the centre of the city of Ayacucho. Licet needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy pants. Licet dreams of having a store of her own and of building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants

loans.name: Isabel Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad.
Haydee es soltera, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Haydee es natural de la ciudad de Arequipa y vive 15 años en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Haydee vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Haydee vende calzados a pedido que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos de vestir.
Los sueños de Haydee son compra una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y trabajar en una institución de Salud.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the "Generosidad" community bank. Haydee is single; she is 42 years old and has four children. Haydee was born in Arequipa and lived 15 years in the city of Ayacucho. Haydee sells cosmetics from catalogues, which she offers to her friends and relatives. Haydee also sells shoes by special order as she acquires them from Lima. Haydee needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy dress shoes. Haydee dreams of buying a house in the city of Ayacucho and of working in an institute of health.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dress shoes

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es socio del Banco Comunal La Paz, Felix vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Felix es casado, tiene 43 años y 7 hijos, Felix viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra ganado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, los animales los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Felix necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Felix sueña con educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar.
texts.en:
Felix is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Felix lives in the community of Yanama which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Felix is married; he is 43 years old and has seven children. Felix travels to the various markets in the area to buy livestock with his children's help. He then sells the animals in the city of Ayacucho. Felix needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy cattle. Felix dreams of educating his children, improving his business and of having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad.
Biviana es soltera, tiene 19 años, se esta preparando para ingresar a la universidad y vive con sus padres, Biviana junto a su mama se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, productos que adquieren en la selva ayacuchana y luego lo comercializa en las carpinterías, madereras.
Biviana necesita un prestamo de 2600 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de Biviana son tener una empresa grande y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Biviana is a member of the "Generosidad" community bank. Biviana is 19 years old and single. She is preparing to enter University and lives with her parents. Biviana, together with her mother, buys and sells lumber which they acquire in the Ayacuchan jungle and later sell to carpenters and lumber yards. Biviana needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy lumber. Biviana dreams of having a large business and of buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Maxime Komlan

texts.fr: D. maxime a abandonné très tôt l’école et s’est lancé en 2004 dans l’apprentissage de la prise de photo, aujourd’hui il a ouvert sa propre boutique de photographie qu’il a appelé  « LA VOLONTE DE DIEU », beaucoup de personnes lui font confiance et sollicitent ses services lors des évènements comme les mariages, anniversaires. Son matériel étant un peu vétuste, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 cartouches de pellicules et 02 appareils photos. Il est un célibataire et c’est grâce à cette activité qu’il subvient à ses charges
texts.en:
Maxime D. left school early on and took up an apprenticeship in photography. Today he has opened his own photography studio that he calls « LA VOLONTE DE DIEU » (God's Will). Lots of people trust him and come to him when they need photography services for events such as marriages and anniversaries. His equipment is somewhat obsolete, so he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 30 canisters of film and 2 cameras. He is single and it is with this business that he earns his living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing canisters of film and cameras

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Monsieur A. yao est un résident du quartier d’agoè dalimé, il est marié et a 02 enfants. Il est un topographe dessinateur de métier, mais ne trouvant pas assez de marché, il s’est lancé  l’an dernier dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, il a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’il a appelé « la GRACE », sa clientèle est de jour en jour grandissante pour, répondre convenablement à la demande de sa clientèle il veut agrandir sa boutique par l’achat de 20 boîtes de Tomates , 10 cartons de riz , 05 cartons de pâtes, des cartons de savons et de détergents , 10cartons d’eau minérale.
texts.en:
Mr. Yao A. is a resident of the Agoè Dalimé neighborhood. He is married and has 2 children. He is a draftsman-topographer by trade but since he has not been able to find enough of a market for his specialty, he began to sell groceries last year. He opened a little shop that he calls « la GRACE ». His clientele is growing day by day, and to respond to their demand, he wants to expand his inventory by buying 20 tins of tomatoes, 10 cases of rice, 5 cases of pasta, cases of soap and detergent, and 10 cases of mineral water.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery staples for re-sale

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi KilL. inicia su tercer ciclo con 20 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, comidas, mercerías, abarrotes en general, lácteos, panes, animales menores, tubérculos y tejidos D. chompas.

Como es el caso D. Yovana que es viuda, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Yovana se dedica a L. elaboración D. yogurt, sus ventas los realiza a pedidos. Además Yovana realiza bordados D. manteles, entre otros.

Por otro lado Rosa es soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Rosa se dedica a L. compra y venta D. maní, actividad que realiza en L. feria D. Las Américas.

Mientras que Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito.  

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,350 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra telas, hilos, utensilios D. cocina, cosméticos, arroz, azúcar, leche, frutas, panes, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener capital propio, ampliar sus negocios y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Kusi KilL. Community Bank is beginning its third loan cycle with twenty members. The members have businesses that sell a variety of items, such as fruit, food, notions, general merchandise, dairy products, bread, small animals, root vegetables, and woven sweaters. For example, Yovana is a 41-year-old widow with five children. Her business is making yogurt, which she sells by taking orders from customers. Yovana also embroiders tablecloths, among other things. On the other hand, Rosa is a single 42-year-old with three children. She buys and sells peanuts at the “Las Américas” market. While Elizabeth, a 21-year-old mother of one son who lives with her partner, sells cosmetics from catalogs. She sells them to friends and relatives on credit. The group's members need differing loan amounts, 300, 450, or 600 Peruvian nuevos soles, for a grand total of 10,350 nuevos soles to be loaned to the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, cooking utensils, cosmetics, rice, sugar, milk, fruit, bread, and small animals. The members of the group hope that their children will complete their studies. They also dream of having their own financial resources, expanding their businesses, and building homes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, cooking utensils, cosmetics, rice, sugar, milk, fruit, bread, and small animals.

loans.name: Arme Du Christ Group

texts.en:
The “Arme du ChriS.” or “Army of ChriS.” Group is a made of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1S. loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 2nd loan.

Though small, the group has a wide range of businesses from food sales and used clothing, to live animals. Nelly M. is one of three representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two children.

The hardworking mom sells a variety of items based on the needs of her clients. She mostly sells food items including sugar, flour, oils, rice, spices, and some vegetables. Her business and family were both able to benefit from the loan because prior to the loan, she says, her children’s meals were not as regular as they should be whereas now, the entire family is able to eat three meals a day.  She hopes to continually grow her business and increase her savings so that she may finish school, go to college and eventually get married.

On behalf of Nelly, Arme du ChriS., and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, rice, oils, and vegetables

loans.name: Brillantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Brillantes inicia su sexto ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. golosinas, abarrotes en general, materiales D. construcción, comidas, prendas D. vestir, helados, leña y fabricación D. ladrillos.

Como es el caso D. Gloria que es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Gloria se dedica a la compra D. maderas, leña, Gloria compra árboles y hace leña, sus ventas los realiza

Por otro lado Eliza es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Eliza tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, gas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Mientras Teresa es casada, tiene 60 años y 1 hija, Teresa tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900soles, haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. árboles, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, ropa, golosinas, helados.  

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Brillantes Community Bank is beginning its sixth loan cycle with fifteen members. The group's members have businesses which sell a variety of items, such as sweets, general merchandise, construction materials, food, clothing, ice cream, wood, and bricks. For example, Gloria is a married 35-year-old with four children. She sells wood and logs. Gloria purchases trees, chops them into logs, and then sells them herself. On the other hand, Eliza is a 34-year-old mother of two children who lives with her common-law husband. She has a shop in her home where she sells groceries, gas, and vegetables. Her husband helps her keep the shop open every day of the week. While Teresa is a married 60-year-old with one daughter. She has a shop that sells general merchandise and vegetables. The members need differing loan amounts (300, 600, or 900 Peruvian nuevos soles), for a grand total of 9,900 nuevos soles to be loaned to the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of trees, rice, sugar, milk, oil, clothing, sweets, and ice cream. The group's members hope to build their own homes and improve their businesses. They also hope that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase trees, rice, sugar, milk, oil, clothing, sweets, and ice cream

loans.name: Essi Dodzi

texts.fr: En 2007, T.-G. Essi dodzi s’est lancé dans le commerce en gros d’eau minérale VOLTIC, elle a ouvert à cet effet un dépôt d’eau minérale VOLTIC à adidogomé à soviépé, ce commerce est très rentable pour elle car elle est la seule à vendre en gros dans son quartier, la demande de sa clientèle est très élevée, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter en gros des sachets d’eau minérale VOLTIC. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est imprimeur, ensemble ils ont eu 02.
texts.en:
In 2007, Essi Dodzi T.-G. began selling VOLTIC mineral water wholesale. She opened a depot for this mineral water in Adidogomé in Soviépé. This business is very remunerative for her since she is the only person who sells the water wholesale in her neighborhood. The demand from her clientele is very high, so she is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of VOLTIC mineral water wholesale. She is married to a printer and they have 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of VOLTIC mineral water

loans.name: Enyonam Afi

texts.fr: Dame Afi enyonam est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé, elle est divorcée de son mari et à 03 enfants, pour subvenir convenablement à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale en 2007, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, la qualité de son accueil fait qu’elle conquiert  tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de lait, 04 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 02 sacs de riz, 06 bidons d’huile et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi Enyonam lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé neighborhood. She is divorced from her husband and has 3 children. To support herself and her children adequately, she began selling groceries in 2007. She buys her merchandise in the big open-air market in Lomé. Her warm welcome allows her to win more customers every day. Wishing to expand her inventory, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 2 cases of milk, 4 cases of pasta, 2 sacks of rice, 6 jerry cans of oil, and various other grocery products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Gentille

texts.fr: B. Gentille est une demoiselle qui a appris le métier de la coiffure, en 2007 elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure « GOD IS GREAT » dans son quartier, quelques temps après elle y a associé le commerce de produits de beauté, elle est très dynamique et a beaucoup de clientes dont la plupart des femmes de son quartier et des quartiers voisins. Elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 mèches, 12 tissages perruques, divers crèmes. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son activité elle subvient à ses charges et à celles de sa famille
texts.en:
B. Gentille is a young lady who learned the trade of hairdressing. In 2007, she opened a hair salon "GOD IS GREAT" in her area. Awhile afterwards, she included along with it commerce in beauty products. She is very energetic and has many customers, most of whom are women from her district and from neighboring districts. She's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 hair extensions, 12 woven wigs, and various creams. With what she earns from her work, she supports herself and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Geneviève Rita

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier  de Teshie, A. Geneviève   est une femme très travailleuse,  elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits de mercerie, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2004, ses clientèles sont principalement des couturières et des tailleurs. Voulant agrandir son commerce et réaliser de meilleures recettes, elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat des articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est médecin dans une clinique, ensemble ils ont eu 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A resident of the Teshie district, A. Geneviève is a hard-working woman. She earns an income through commerce in sewing supplies. She started in this business in 2004. Her customers are mainly seamstresses and tailors. Wanting to expand her business and to realize better receipts, she's asking WAGES for her first loan to buy sewing supplies. She is married to a gentleman who is a mechanic in a clinic. Together they had two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Folly Komlan

texts.fr: Monsieur A. a commencé l’année dernière  le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Le dynamisme, la qualité de son accueil et de ses prestations lui ont permis de gagner la confiance de ses clients, voulant agrandir son stock et réaliser de bons chiffre d’affaire il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 cartons de lait en poudre, 04 sacs de produits FANMILK, 10 bidons d’huiles et des cartons de biscuits. Monsieur A. est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est avec le revenu tiré de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
Last year, Mr. A. started doing commerce in grocery items. His dynamism and the quality of his reception and performance have earned him the trust of his customers. Wanting to expand his inventory and to obtain good sales figures, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy four boxes of powdered milk, four bags of FANMILK goods, ten drums of oil, and boxes of cookies. Mr. A. is married and the father of one child. With the revenues derived from his commerce, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Kouami Demanya

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a commencé en 2004 le commerce d’articles scolaires et livres, il y a associé le commerce de biscuits. Le troisième trimestre étant proche pour la reprise des classes à lomé, il voudrait acheter de nouveaux livres et articles scolaires qui lui permettrait d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Étant marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouami Demanya began in 2004 to sell school supplies and books. He added on the sale of sweet biscuits (cookies). Back-to-school day for the third trimester is near in Lomé, so he would like to buy new books and school supplies so that he can make more sales. He is married and the father of 2 children, and it is this business that permits him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of school supplies, books and such for re-sale

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur B. Diarra est un célibataire de 21 ans qui  vit chez son père  dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Monsieur B. Diarra a très tôt abandonné l’école au profit du commerce qui ses parents menaient.
Pendant des années Monsieur B. Diarra a mené l’activité d’achat et de vente de céréales au marché de Bougouni, mais cela ne lui a pas réussi.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida  de s’éssaya  à l’activité d’achat et de  vente de pièces détachées et de lubrifiants  auprès de son grand frère.
Avec 2 années d’expérience, Monsieur B. Diarra maitrise bien son activité et très réputé dans ce créneau qui lui réussi bien. Il est à son premier prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte acheter 20 cartons de 5 bidons à huile moteur et des petites pièces détachées.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur B. Diarra compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’agrandir son entreprise et de rembourser les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. B. Diarra, age 21, lives at his father's house in the Hérémakono Centre neighborhood in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. B. Diarra dropped out of school at an early age, to help his parents with their business. For years, Mr. B. Diarra bought and sold cereals at the Bougouni market, but this business was not successful. He thus decided to try another business, namely buying and selling spare parts and lubricants with his elder brother. Having two years of experience, Mr. B. Diarra masters his business and is well-renowned in this field, where he's doing well. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and intends to buy 20 boxes of 5 cans of motor oil, as well as small spare parts. He gets his supplies in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. With this loan, Mr. B. Diarra foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 120), which will enable him to expand his business and repay the loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of 5 cans of motor oil and small spare parts

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Paz y Amor inicia su ciclo 14 con 20 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Pacaycasa que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, frutas, bebidas, tara, cochinilla y la fabricación D. ladrillos.

Como es el caso D. Reyna que es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hija, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además compra tara, cochinilla que luego venD. a los intermediarios.

Por otro lado Demetria es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Demetria junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. ladrillos artesanales, el quemado D. los ladrillos lo realizan en hornos alquilados.

Mientras que Paulina es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Paulina venD. cerveza, gaseosa, actividad que realiza en su casa, además los días domingos venD. comida en el estadio D. su comunidad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 12,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azucar, carne, frutas, bebidas y el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar, surtir sus negocios, comprar una computadora para sus hijos, tener otro negocio mas y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Paz y Amor” (“Peace and Love”) Community Bank is beginning its fourteenth loan cycle with twenty members. The group is from the Pacaycasa district, located forty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The group's members have businesses which sell a variety of items, such as general merchandise, meat, vegetables, fruit, drinks, tara seeds (used to make tannic acid and starch), pill bugs (used to make ink), and bricks. For example, Reyna is a 29-year-old mother of one daughter who lives with her common law husband. She has a shop in her home where she sells groceries. She also purchases tara seeds and pill bugs to later sell to intermediaries. On the other hand, Demetria is married, 33 years old, and has three children. Together with her husband, Demetria makes artisanal bricks and fires them in rented ovens. While Paulina is 39-years-old, has five children, and lives with her common law husband. Paulina sells beer and soft drinks from her home. On Sundays, she also sells food at the local sports stadium. The group's members need differing loan amounts (300, 450, or 600 Peruvian nuevos soles), for a grand total of 12,950 nuevos soles to be loaned to the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, meat, fruit, and drinks and to pay workers' salaries. The bank's members dream of expanding and stocking their businesses, buying computers for their children, having other businesses, and providing their children with good educations.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, meat, fruit, and drinks and to pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 51 años, vive con su hijo de 18 años en su casa propia. Ella recorre diariamente las principales calles de su ciudad para vender diversos artículos de uso personal; como prendas de vestir íntimas, pasadores de zapatos, cosméticos, ganchos, entre otros artículos. Esta actividad es muy gratificante porque le permite conocer nuevas personas y  darles un voto de confianza, ya que ubica a sus clientes en sus propios domicilios y luego les cobra diariamente. Debido a las largas caminatas que realiza Ermelinda, queda muy agotada, sin embargo, esto es compensado con las ganancias obtenidas. Por ello tiene el deseo de continuar y hacer crecer su negocio; uno de sus planes es implementar un bazar en un local céntrico de su ciudad, dando a conocer a sus clientes su establecimiento. Es la segunda vez que Ermelinda viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de trabajar en un banco comunal porque le permite estar en contacto con su grupo, quienes son persona de confianza. Esta cantidad de dinero la invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, para esta época escolar desea adquirir uniformes y accesorios para el colegio.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is 51 years old. She lives with her 18 year old son in their house. Every day she walks the main streets of her city in order to sell a variety of items for personal use such as intimate apparel, shoe laces, cosmetics, hooks, among other items. This activity is very gratifying because it allows her to meet new people and give them a vote of confidence as she visits her customers in their own homes and later collects payments from them. Due to the long walks that Ermelinda takes, she becomes very tired; nevertheless, her earnings are compensation for this. She wants to continue to grow her business. One of her plans is to open a bazaar in a central location in her city, publicizing her establishment to her customers. This is the second time that Ermelinda has asked for a loan from MFP. She is very happy about working in a communal bank because it allows her to be in contact with her group, who are trustworthy people. This money will be used to buy more merchandise; this school year she would like to buy uniforms and accessories for school.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono nord de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers,  apprise auprès de son oncle maternel.
Avec une expérience de 4 ans, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir sa boutique, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé décida de solliciter le concours de Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter divers articles (thé, biscuit, insecticides, anti moustique en spirale, lames rasoir, cigarettes etc.)  
Il est à son premier prêt individuel  avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et a une  clientèle  constituée de toute les catégories sociales.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage de construire sa maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Zoumana Dembélé, age 32, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and his children in the Hérémakono neighborhood, in the north of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having never attended school, he started working early on, and got introduced to selling various items by his mother's brother. Having now four years of experience, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé masters his business. To expand his shop, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé decided to seek help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy various items (tea, biscuits, insecticides, spiral mosquito repellents, razor blades, cigarettes, etc). He's seeking his first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali, and has a clientele comprising all social categories. With this loan, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to build his own home.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for his retail store

loans.name: Adzowa Eyonam

texts.fr: S. adzowa a toujours voulu apprendre le métier de la couture, malheureusement elle n’a pas pu, elle s’est alors lancée en 1999 dans le commerce  d’articles de mercerie, ayant besoin actuellement d’agrandir son stock d’articles de mercerie afin de mieux vendre et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrait d’acheter divers articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée et 05 enfants, avec le revenu tiré de son commerce elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adzowa S. always wanted to learn to be a seamstress, but unfortunately, she was not able to, so she started up a little business selling notions. She now needs to expand her inventory of sewing supplies, so as to sell more and thus make more profit. She has asked WAGES for her first loan which will permit her to buy various sewing supplies for re-sale. She is married and has 5 children; with the income from her little business, she contributes to supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of notions for re-sale

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales. Su dinámica de trabajo consiste en comprar los animales los días sábados muy temprano (madrugada) luego los vende en la feria ganadera, generalmente lo que le sobra son cuyes, los que almacena en su granja, los demás animales los deja en casa de su suegra para no gastar en transporte, porque el lugar donde vende está ubicado en otra provincia de su localidad y de considerable distancia. Este negocio le ha permitido tener más ingresos para su familia, ya que su esposo, por su parte, trabaja lejos de la ciudad y muchas veces su sueldo no abastece por completo las necesidades de su casa. Ahora Inés tiene muchos planes de seguir trabajando y comprase un terreno cercano al punto de sus ventas donde pueda guardar a sus animales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte de este banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser una integrante participe, activa y colaboradora de su grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de animales como ovejas, cerdos y cuyes, con los cuales aumentará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Inés is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in her parents’ house. For 2 years she has been buying and selling animals. Her work consists of going very early (at dawn) on Saturdays to buy the animals. She then sells them at the livestock fair. Generally the guinea pigs are left, and she keeps them on her farm. The place where she sells is in another province which is very far, so she leaves the rest of the animals at her mother-in-law’s to save having to transport them. This business has given her more income for her family. Her husband works far from the city, and many times his salary does not completely cover the household expenses. Inés plans to keep working. She also plans to buy a piece of land near her selling location where she can keep and sell her animals. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a part of this community bank. She promises to participate and be an active collaborator in her group. She will use the loan to buy animals like sheep, pigs and guinea pigs. This will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of animals she sells

loans.name: Jeselin

texts.es: Jeselin tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la  venta de quesos desde hace 2 años, para ello usa 2 baldes, donde deposita sus productos y los lleva a los principales mercados para venderlos de manera ambulante a un precio cómodo. Para abastecerse viaja a las zonas rurales de su localidad donde producen quesos y compra en mayor cantidad, puede llegar a va vender hasta 30 moldes de queso al día, ya que su habilidad para las ventas es sorprendente y tiene deseos de seguir con esta actividad porque  es un negocio que le permite ser independiente económicamente y aportar en la casa de sus padres. Jeselin también quiere incursionar en la crianza de cuyes porque ha notado la demanda de estos animales para los grandes banquetes sociales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta porque fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal debido a ser reconocida como una persona responsable. Jeselin quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, por lo que solicita esta cantidad de dinero para comprar quesos e implementar su granja de cuyes.
texts.en:
Jeselin is 23 years old. She lives with her parents and siblings in their own home. She has been dedicated to selling cheese for two years, for which she uses two buckets in which she places her products and takes them to the main markets to sell them on foot at a reasonable price. In order to get supplies, she travels to rural areas in her region where they produce cheese and she makes purchases in large quantities. She is able to sell close to 30 blocks of cheese a day. Her sales skills are surprising and she has desires to continue this activity because it is a business that allows her to be financially independent and support her parents' household. Jeselin also wishes to start raising guinea pigs because she has noticed the demand for these animals for large social banquets. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy because she was invited to be a part of her community bank due to being known as a responsible person. Jeselin would like to increase her working capital for which she is requesting an amount of money to purchase cheese and start her guinea pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 42 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Desde hace 3 años tiene una tienda en su misma casa, esta oportunidad de negocio le permitió generar sus propios ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Maribel atiende su establecimiento durante todo el día y todos los días de la semana; por las mañanas tiene más clientes  que por las tardes, sus hijos también le ayudan en la atención de su negocio cuando es necesario. Dependiendo de la época del año la demanda de comestibles sube o baja, por ello que aprovecha los primeros meses de campaña escolar para vender útiles de escritorio. Es la primera vez que Maribel viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y tiene deseos de continuar trabajando para su progreso. La cantidad requerida es para la compra de mercadería en golosinas, refrescos y otras bebidas en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and lives with her two children in her mother's house. For three years, she has had a store in her house, this business opportunity has allowed her to generate her own income for the sustenance of her children. Maribel attends her establishment during the whole day and every day of the week; in the morning she has more customers than in the afternoon, her children also help her with the attendance of the business when necessary. Depending on the season the demand for groceries rises and falls, so she takes advantage of the first few months of the school year to sell school supplies. This is the first time Maribel comes asking for a loan with MFP, and se is very happy to be part of the communal bank and has hopes to continue working for its progress. The required amount is to buy merchandise like sodas, soft drinks and other drinks in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace medio años se dedica a la venta de comida hecha a base de cerdo, debido a un traspaso comercial, su establecimiento se ubica cerca de una universidad, en el comienzo de su negocio era un riesgo para Nora, pero ha visto que su negocio se ha ido incrementando por la calidad de la comida que prepara y ofrece al atardecer hasta altas horas de la noche. Para ella cocinar es una distracción, disfruta de hacerlo, y ahora más que nunca porque le genera buenos recursos económicos, necesarios para su familia. Además, la comida que actualmente vende tiene mayor demanda entre los universitarios que acuden a consumir sus platillos. Para más adelante, Nora quiere complementar su establecimiento con la venta de jugos y también ofrecer menús durante el medio día para el almuerzo. Es la cuarta vez que Nora tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas más colaboradoras de su banco comunal, siempre está en búsqueda de nuevas mejoras para su grupo. La cantidad que ahora solicita es para mejorar la decoración y ambientación de su local, está decidida a comprar nueva vajilla que mejore la presentación de sus comidas. Y con una parte (110 soles) comprará útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a rented house. For about six months, she has been dedicated to selling food made from pork. Due to a commercial exchange, her establishment is located close to a university. Starting a business was a risk for Nora but she has seen that her business is growing due to the quality of the food that she prepares and offers from afternoon until the late hours of the night. For her, cooking is a distraction which she enjoys doing and now, more than ever, since it generates good income, it is necessary for her family. In addition, the food that she currently sells is generating greater demand among the university students who come to consume her dishes. For the future, Nora wishes to complement her business by selling juices and also to offer service during the middle of the day, for lunch. This is the fourth time that Nora has taken a loan with MFP. She one of the most collaborative people in her community bank. She is always on the lookout for new improvements for her group. The amount that she is now requesting is to improve the decoration and atmosphere of her cafe. She has decided to purchase new tableware to improve the presentation of her food. And a part (110 soles) will go towards buying school supplies for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better atmosphere for her cafe.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent A. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, including twins. She says the twins are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Millicent is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles such as women’s clothes and bed sheets. She sells her goods locally and also treks to other markets to sell. She procures bales of textiles from wholesalers in the nearby towns. Apart from the textile selling, Millicent also supplies green vegetables (cocoyam leaves) to schools.
Millicent has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles.

loans.use: To procure bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi N. is fifty-one years old and married with six children. Kofi is the local name given to Friday-born males in Ghana. According to Kofi, four of his children have completed senior high school. The last two, however, are still in  senior high school. Currently, Kofi lives with his children and wife in an old family house in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. He owns a shop in the market square where he sells provisions. He procures provisions such as sugar, tins of milk, milo, candies, etc. from the wholesalers in the nearby cities at favorable prices. Kofi has been in this business for over twenty-four years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to stock his shop. He hopes to sponsor his children to further their education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for his shop.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati S. is a 35-year-old divorcee with two children. Her husband was playing around. She could not bear it and thought it best to get on without him. She lives with her children at Eguase, a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. Fati belongs to a village bank called “Kronkronye Name” which literally means “God’s Holiness”.

Times have been very tough for Fati but she decided not to give up. Fati learned a trade to earn a living. She now runs a food vending stand and sells cocoa drink with pastries. She prepares those pastries with flour, sugar, margarine, eggs etc. She normally sells in the morning between 6:00 am and 11:00 am. After that, she quickly switches to her slipper sales, hawking throughout the community.

Prices of the ingredients have gone up making it difficult to buy more from the market. Fati has insufficient working capital to scale up the business. This loan will enable her to purchase good quality supplies in large quantity to upgrade her stores. Fati is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for pastries and slippers for resale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Two of them have completed senior high school while the rest are still in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Georgina is a food vendor. She sells a local food called ‘apitie’. Apitie is prepared by mixing ripe plantain with maize and then baking it. She prepares the food in the house and sells in the local market square. She procures the raw materials, maize and plantain, from the local market. She has been in this business for five years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk.

loans.use: To procure maize and ripe plantain.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa T. is 30 years old she is divorced with two children. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells ‘bodo’ in her community. Bodo is prepared from milled maize, which is then put on a special leaf, boiled, and eaten with fish. There is a small, small fish they call ‘one man thousand’, and this is the fish that is eaten with bodo. Bodo is a traditional food mostly enjoyed by the Fantes who are in the coastal areas. Bodo is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She boils it in a big pot and sells it through hawking.

She has been in this business for seven years now with no regrets. She said it is far better than being idle or begging for bread in the street. Through her hard efforts, demand for her food has increased, making it difficult to meet her customers' demands. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize, fish, vegetables, etc., so that she can prepare more to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is glad for your support. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, fishes, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba T. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Three of her children are in school; the little one is still breastfeeding. She resides at Eguase, a suburb of Moore, in the central part of Ghana. Her husband does not have a permanent job, so the entire household depends on her for food and other minor expenses.

She is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice and stew in the area where she lives. Apart from the rice and stew she also sells ‘chibom’, fried eggs with bread together with tea, at night. Chibom is a term people use when they are having such food. She combines these two businesses by herself. She serves the rice in the morning to afternoon and prepares herself for the evening section. She has been in business for six years now. Initially she solely depended on herself but has realized her strength is not enough to meet the market demand. She needs a loan to buy bulk supply of rice, eggs, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. With the loan she believes she will be equipped to provide for her children's educational needs. Aba would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 27 years old. She is married and a mother of one kid. Currently, the kid is breastfeeding. She lives with her husband who is a businessman. Her family is doing very well, and she is so happy about that. Vida is in the service industry sewing dresses and clothing. She has been sewing for two years now, and is a specialist in women's clothes. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Vida has one apprentice whom she is giving quality training for her future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with a quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for sewing such as linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana H. is a 29 year old woman, and is married with two kids. All her children are in school. Asana is a Muslim by birth and a very resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able work hard to provide her kids with a quality education for better future careers. She believes this will happen, as she is determined to support her children. Her husband is a government worker. They live together in Eguase in the central region of Ghana.

She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to save more to finance her kids’ school fees. She will be grateful for your loan support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba G. is a 40 year old trader. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in Eguase, in the central region of Ghana. She sells used clothes and footwear through hawking. She purchases her stock of goods from importers in Accra Ghana. Aba has ten years of sales experience in the field of marketing.

Through this business, she manages to support her children's education from the business proceeds. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to increase her business. Aba has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan will enable her to make remarkable business progress.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes of a greater variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Aba belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement, as he is popularly called, is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with twins who are breastfeeding. Clement M. is very hard working. He is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests this loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support. He has been in this business for the past seven years, gaining a lot of experience with a wider market share. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of electrical appliances.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael B. is 30 years old. He is single with one kid who is currently in school. Michael is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He also sells video CD’s, movies, etc. just in front of his shop.

Michael has been in business for three years now. Prices of raw materials have shot up significantly, which is making it difficult to stock his shop. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and television. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela G. tiene ya mas de 1 año con su negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y venta de dulces, esté es el ingreso de su familia. 
El negocio esta ubicado en una colonia muy poblada, pero esta muy retirada de su domicilio y el vehiculo que tienen para trasportarse y llevar la mercancía el lugar de venta. Esta en malas condiciones, y no cuentan con el capital necesario para repararlo. Portal motivo están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la reparación de vehiculo.
texts.en:
Gabriela G. has more than one year's experience with her business selling prepared food and desserts. This provides income for her family. This business is located in a well populated area but it is far from her home and the car that she uses for transportation and to carry merchandise to their place of sale is in bad condition and she does not have the necessary money to repair it. The main reason for requesting this loan is to be able to pay for car maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a car for the business.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. Currently two are in school, and the eldest is a taxi driver. She lives in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Vida is very hardworking and dedicated to the upbringing of her children. She sells sweet potatoes and maize. And it is this business that has supported her family. 

Vida distributes the food stuffs to her customers on a credit basis. She takes delivery of stock from the surrounding farming communities and has been in this business for two years now. She needs a loan to buy more sweet potatoes and bags of maize so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance. Vida belongs to a group called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help'. She also hopes to receive the loan to progress her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy bunches of potatoes and bags of maize.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a married with one young child. She lives with her husband and child in Eguase, which is a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. Central region is one of the tourist centers in Ghana. But there is a high rate of poverty and little infrastructure development in the region. It has been the sitting government's desire to minimize the poverty rate there through its strategic plan for the region. This has left many families to struggle to take care of their family and themselves.

Esther A. works very hard because she has partial responsibility for her child, as a mother who wants to see her child achieve a certain level in life. She is now 21 years old. She has sold home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates for three years now. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door to door sales. Esther is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her husband. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for your support. Esther belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help’. She hope to receive a loan to progress her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu I. is thirty-nine years old and married with two children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She sells local rice. Local rice is mostly harvested in the northern part of Ghana. She is also a food vendor who prepares “waakye” and stew. Waakye is local rice enjoyed by many Ghanaians.

She treks to the northern region to buy her raw materials like bags of rice in bulk, with other needed items like meat, beans, vegetable oil, etc. Mamunatu started this business when she was twenty-one years old. It means she was very young when she started this food production. She is facing a financial crisis in trying to expand her business and she wants a loan to buy more bags of the local rice, gallons of vegetable oil, meat, etc. With the loan she believes she can be fully able to realize this dream of hers to be successful in business. She will be grateful for your assistance. Mamunatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help’. She hopes to receive a loan make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of the local rice, gallons of vegetable oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu A. is 37 years old, divorced and mother of two children. Among her children, one is learning a trade and the other one is in school. Zenabu has sold frozen food in her local community for 15 years now. But she says income from the sales is very low since she pays high rent on the store she operates and the electricity cost is also high as she shares the power with another shop nearby.

She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen food to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself and also to stock her inventory. She also sells Fanti kenkey (a type of dumpling wrapped in leaves) by the road in her community where she lives. She needs the loan urgently and hopes to pay within the time limit. Zenabu belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help’. She hopes to receive a loan to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen food.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario R. tiene 31 años. Está casado hace 11 años con la señora Florentina Gimenez de 43 años de edad. Ella trabaja en forma independiente como peluquera, manicurista y realiza tambien masajes terapeuticos. El matrimonio tiene un hijo de 10 años quien está cursando el 6to. grado.

El sr. Mario fue empleado de una casa comercial por mas de cinco años pero cuando se le liquido tenia un pequeño ahorro con el cual emprendio su negocio de venta de ropas, calzados, entre otros.

El sueño del matrimonio es que su hijo pueda seguir una carrera universitaria y tener una preparación académica que le permita tener un futuro mejor.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de jeans, camisas, remeras, calzados deportivos y de esta forma aumentar su stock de mercaderias y asi cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario R. is 31 years old. He has been married for 11 years to Ms. Florentina Gimenez, who is 43 years old. She works as an independent hairdresser and manicurist and also does therapeutic massage. The couple has one 10-year old son who is in the sixth grade.

Mr. R. worked at a firm for more than 5 years but when it was sold off, he used his small savings to launch his own business selling clothes and shoes, among other things.

The dream of this couple is that their son can go to university and have the academic preparation to have a better future.

The client is requesting the loan to buy jeans, shirts, T-shirts and sports shoes to increase his stock and fill his clients' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, T-shirts, shirts, shorts, skirts, and shoes

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan Francisco
texts.en: Mr. Juan Francisco

loans.use: Putting up a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La sra. Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas como aretes, anillos, sombrereras, topos, por la zona, vive con su esposo, que trabaja como chofer asalariado, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar, ambos se ocupan de los gastos de la casa, con el apoyo de sus suegros cuando ellos salen a trabajar. El crédito será invertido en la adquisición de más joyas ya que tiene mas pedidos por  la cercanía de la fiesta de Jesus del Gran Poder. La Fiesta  de Jesus del Gran Poder, es una fiesta pagano-religiosa floclorica, que atraviesa todo el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, es muy popular entre los turistas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa L. C. sells jewelry such as earrings and rings, as well as hatboxes, in the area. She lives with her husband, who works as a wage-earning driver. They have three school-age children. Both parents look after household expenses, and their parents help out when they go out to work.

The loan will be invested in acquiring more jewelry, as there is higher demand due to the celebration of Jesus del Gran Poder. This is a pagan-religious celebration that crosses through the whole downtown area of La Paz and is very muy popular with tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Macario C. le está haciendo falta la barda al rededor de ella, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar el material que necesita. Él se dedica a la construcción y se encargara de elaborar la barda en horario adicionales a su trabajo. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para llevar a cabo la mejora lo más pronto posible, para que su familia esté segura cuando no se encuantre en su casa.  La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del Sr. C. y es la señora María De Jesús Puentes fue ella quien atendió la visita, ya que Don Macario le fue imposible estar presente en la fotografía pues se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
At the home of Mr. Macario C., the wall around the house is missing, but he does not have the necessary capital to buy the materials he needs, since he is working on building the house and will be in charge of making the wall in addition to his regular work schedule. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to complete the improvements as soon as possible, so that his family is safe when he is not at home. The person appearing in the photo is his wife, Mrs. Maria De Jesus Puentes, who met with us since Mr. Macario was working.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putchase of material for building the wall around his house.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en la Barrio San Blas distante a 200m de la oficina de Carapeguá, uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa.
 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las actividades ya mencionados mas arriba. Ellas estaban buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

1	Mirian V.	Docente
2	Ma- Isabel L.	Venta de bebidas 
3	Amelia M.	Masajista
4	Eloisa G.	Tejedora
5	Ma-Lourdes M.	Verduras
6	Francisca M.	Venta de comidas
7	Rosa M.	Empleada
8	Lourdes C. 	Empleada
9	Liz G.	Tejedora
10	Margarita L.	Venta de Chipa
11	Susana A.	Almacén
12	Ma-Felipa C.	Venta de ropas
13	Valeriana C.	Modista
14	Mirtha B.	Tejedoras
15	Noelia R. 	despensa
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá in Barrio San Blas, located 200m from the office of Carapeguá, some women of limited means learned about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs program and decided to get together to receive information about the program. These ladies are very active and industrious and work in the activities mentioned below. They are looking for a little more support through a loan to boost their family incomes and improve their quality of life. They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs so as to achieve sustainable growth that makes them grow as a group and individually. 1 Mirian V. - Teacher 2 Ma-Isabel L. -Selling beverages 3 Amelia M. - Massage 4 Eloisa G. - Weaver 5 Ma-Lourdes M. - Selling vegetables 6 Francisca M. - Selling meals 7 Rosa M. - Employee 8 Lourdes C. - Employee 9 Liz G. - Weaver 10 Margarita L. - Selling breads 11 Susana A. - Grocery shop 12 Ma-Felipa C. - Selling clothing 13 Valeriana C. - Dress maker 14 Mirtha B. - Weaver 15 Noelia R. - Food shop

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The majority of the members of the Committee invested their loan proceeds in their current activities as listed below.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucía se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de Capiatá desde hace cerca de dos años; se conocen bastante bien y han aprendido a trabajar de manera organizada. Sus actividades económicas la realizan en sus casas y en la venta casa por casa, recorriendo tanto por el barrio como en zonas aledañas.

1	Mirian F.	Venta de ropas
2	Estela P.	Venta de ropas
3	Liz J.	Técnica radióloga
4	Mabel E.	Despensa
5	Juliana C.	Venta de joyas
6	Maria R.	Venta de Asadito
7	Clara R.	Venta de comidas
8	Laura Resquín	Venta de cosméticos
9	Nancy Resquín	Venta de cosméticos
10	Agustina López	Despensa
11	Elva González	Peluquera
12	Virginia Fernández	Venta de frutas y verduras
13	Ramona E.	Venta de ropas
14	Perla González	Venta de ropas
15	Gladys C. 	Costurera
16	Antonia J. 	Venta de ropas
texts.en:
The Santa Lucía loan group began their work in the city of Capiatá about two years ago. They have gotten to know one another quite well and have learned to work in an organized way. They are carrying out their business activities in their homes and in door-to-door sales covering not just their neighborhood but also the surrounding areas. 1 Mirian F. . . . Clothing sales. 2 Estela P. . . . Clothing sales. 3 Liz J. . . . Xray technician. 4 Mabel E. Grocery store. 5 Juliana C. Jewelry sales. 6 Maria R. Sale of grilled food. 7 Clara R. Grocery sales. 8 Laura Resquín Cosmetic sales. 9 Nancy Resquín Cosmetic sales. 10 Agustina López Grocery store. 11 Elva González Hairdresser. 12 Virginia Fernández Sale of fruits & vegetables. 13 Ramona E. Clothing sales. 14 Perla González Clothing sales. 15 Gladys C. Seamstress. 16 Antonia J. Clothing sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their sales, and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 59 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su hija. Hace 3 años decidió iniciar un negocio D. venta D. carne, atienD. todas las mañanas para abastecer a las amas D. casa D. este producto D. primera necesidad. Cirila ofrece carnes D. diversas variedades como res, pollo, pescado entre otros. Su puesto está ubicado en un mercadillo cercano a su casa, las ventas son muy buenas, por esa razón su esposo y su hija siempre la ayudan en la atención. Es la segunda vez que Cirila está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que promueve las buenas relaciones interpersonales en su grupo y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. La cantidad requerida será utilizada en la compra D. más mercadería, además D. mejorar la infraestructura D. su puesto D. ventas.
texts.en:
Cirila is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. Three years ago she decided to start her own business selling meat, working every morning to supply this important product to housewives. Cirila sells different types of meat including beef, chicken, and fish. Her stall is in the little market near her house. She has good sales, which is why her husband and her daughter always help her out.

This is the second time that Cirila is requesting a loan from MFP. In her communal bank, she is one of the membmers who promotes good intra-group relations. She promises to be punctual with her payments. The amount she requests will be used to buy more merchandise, in addition to improving the set-up of her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia tiene 29 años, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposa y su hijo de 7 años. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir al por menor, repartiendo a distintos lugares de su localidad y en ocasiones viaja a otras ciudades aledañas. Su jornada de trabajo consiste en ofrecer la ropa por las mañanas y cobrar sus cuentas pendientes. Para abastecerse de mercadería viaja cada 15 días a la ciudad de Lima para comprar al por mayor, de esto depende sus ganancias, las cuales obtiene semanalmente. Elia reconoce que estar viajando y caminando constantemente es muy cansado, pero tiene sus recompensas. Para el futuro quiere  establecerse en un puesto de ventas. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, desea seguir participando activamente  en su banco comunal porque disfruta de relacionarse con cada integrante de su grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
Elia is 29 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband and her 7 year-old son. She sells garments wholesale and distributes them to different areas of the town and sometimes to other towns. Her workday consists of selling clothes in the morning and recovering outstanding payments. To supply her stock, she travels every 15 days to Lima to buy products wholesale. Her earnings, which she gets every week, depend on this.

Elia recognies that traveling and walking constantly is very tiring, but it has its rewards. In the future she wants to set up in a stall.

This is her second time borrowing with MFP. She wants to continue actively participating in her communal bank because she enjoys interacting with the other members of her group. She will invest the loan in buying more stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing stock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas se encuentra trabajando en la zona de Cerrito, Capiatá, hace cerca de dos años. Se reunen habitualmente los días lunes y siempre que pueden pagan adelantado. Todos los ciclos completan de una o dos semanas antes de la fecha. Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen, tanto en sus respectivos domicilios como recorriendo casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos.

Liz Lorena B.	Cocinera - 
Silvia R.	Venta de Ropas - 
Teresita A.	Venta de Joyas - 
Zulma B.	Venta de bebidas - 
Maria Luisa A.	Despensa - 
Inmaculada R.	Kiosko - 
Crecencia R.	Venta de ropas - 
Luciana M.	Venta de ropas - 
Angélica B.	Despensa - 
Ernesta V.	Venta de Carbón - 
Silvia R.	Venta de comidas - 
Jovina O.	Mercería - 
Nilsa C.	Venta de cosméticos - 
Cristina Arévalos	Venta de frutas y verduras - 
Luz Marina M.	Venta de bebidas - 
Aurelia G. 	Venta de Lencería - 
Liliana M. 	Costurera
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas (United Women) has worked in the Cerrito Zone, Capiatá, since two years ago. They meet regularly on Mondays and pay in advance whenever they can. They finish all of the payment cycles one or two weeks before the due date. The women who make up this group sell things in their neighborhood, selling from their own homes or going from house to house to sell their products. Liz Lorena B. Cook - Silvia R. Clothing sales- Teresita A. Jewelry sales - Zulma B. Beverage sales - Maria Luisa A. Food sales - Inmaculada R. Kiosk - Crecencia R. Clothing sales - Luciana M. Clothing sales - Angélica B. Food sales - Ernesta V. Coal sales - Silvia R. Food sales Jovina O. Hardware sales - Nilsa C. Cosmetic sales Cristina Arévalos Fruit and vegetable sales Luz Marina M. Beverage sales Aurelia G. Lingerie sales - Liliana M. Seamstress -

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer
