loans.use: Purchase of clothes, soft drinks, beers, wines; purchase of underwear, purchase of fruits and vegetables, purchase of candy, purchase of sugar, maté, oil, rice, pasta, cookies, milk, etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender desayunos en una avenida principal cercana a su casa, comenzó vendiendo con un balde grande provisto de vasos; en la actualidad, cuenta con un carrito que le permite transportar sus desayunos. Erika vende todas las mañanas y todos los días de la semana, sus clientes son principalmente obreros y viajeros  que  se detienen en el lugar. Con el paso de los años Erika ha visto la creciente  demanda de su comida, y eso garantiza que tenga ganancias de su trabajo. Cada 15 días compra al por mayor sus ingredientes, para ello viaja a la ciudad de Lima para que sea menor su inversión. Para el futuro, Erika tiene grandes proyecciones para su negocio, quiere agrandar su carrito de ventas y tener otro puesto. Es la segunda vez que participa en un banco comunal, el cual sufrió dificultades, pero que ya se han superado, ella se siente orgullosa de ser parte de la solución y no del problema. Con el dinero que solicita comprará víveres para la preparación de desayunos; comprará sacos de quinua, maca; bidones de aceite y un balón de gas para cocinar.
texts.en:
Erika, 31, lives with her husband and children in a rented house. For 10 years she has sold breakfast on a main avenue close to her house. She started selling with a large bucket and glasses. Now she has a cart which allows her to transport her breakfasts. Erika sells every morning and every day of the week. Her customers are primarily workers and travelers who stop in the area. As the years have passed Erika has seen the demand for her food grow. This guarantees that she will have earnings from her work. Every 15 days she buys her ingredients wholesale. To do this she travels to Lima in order to spend less. In the future Erika has big plans for her business. She wants to enlarge her cart and have another stand. This is the second time that she has participated in a community bank. The bank had problems, but they overcome them. She is proud to be part of the solution and not the problem. With the loan she will buy supplies to use in the preparation of the breakfasts. She will buy sacks of quinua and maca (grains); oil drums; and a canister of gas to use while cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula tiene 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres con su hijo de 3 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a realizar bordados de manteles, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su máquina de coser, que le permite avanzar su labor rápidamente, Paula agradece a una de sus amigas que le enseñó este oficio, y ahora ella todos los días se dedica a bordar y  darle un lindo acabado a estos mandiles y manteles que le traen sus clientes. De esta manera puede obtener los ingresos suficientes para sostener a su pequeño hijo. A Paula le gusta realizar esta actividad porque es relativamente fácil y puede atender a su pequeño en casa. Para más adelante quiere seguir realizando estos trabajos pero en mayor cantidad, y también dedicarse a la confección de vestidos. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de empezar un trabajo solidario para que ella y los demás integrantes de su grupo progresen. La cantidad requerida es para comprar una máquina bordadora semi industrial valorizada en 500 soles.
texts.en:
Paula is 19 years old and lives in her parents’ home with her 3-year-old son.

She has embroidered tablecloths for 2 years. Her sewing machine, the main tool of her trade, allows her to do her work quickly. Paula is grateful to one of her friends for teaching her this craft.

Now she embroiders everyday and puts nice finishes on the aprons and tablecloths that her customers bring her. This work has provided her enough income to support her young son; Paula likes her work because it is relatively easy and, working from home, she is able to look after him.

In the future, she wants to expand her existing work and start dressmaking. She is requesting a loan through MFP for the first time and is very keen to start working together with the other members of her group so that they can all make progress.
She is requesting 500 soles to purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Victor es casado, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Victor tiene un restaurante llamado San José ubicado en cerca del mercado Magdalena, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de 5 trabajadoras.
Victor necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas.
Los sueños de Victor son mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio y otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Victor is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita (Morenita Communal Bank). Victor is married, 54 years old and has 3 children. Victor has a restaurant named San José located near the Magdalena Market in a rented location. He runs his restaurant with the support of 5 workers. Victor needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of tables and chairs. Victor’s dreams are to improve his business, to have his own location and to open another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita,
Maribel es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Maribel tiene un puesto en el mercado Nazarenas en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su mama.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lenteja, garbanzo.
Los sueños de Maribel son vender por mayor y que su hijo estudie en un buen colegio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita (Morenita Communal Bank). Maribel is single, is 23 years old and has a son. Maribel has a stand in the Nazarenas Market where she sells groceries in general. She works everyday with the casual help of her mother. Maribel needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of lentils and chickpeas. Maribel’s dreams are to increase sales and that her son will study in a good school.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of lentils and chickpeas.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda tiene 62 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se  dedica a la venta de cosméticos, los que adquiere de las principales  empresas de belleza, reparte todos los días sus productos por medio de visitas a sus clientes,  exponiendo su catalogo de productos y mostrador de colores, perfumería, etc. Para lograr mayor éxito en sus ventas Herlinda acude a los trabajadores de diversas instituciones para ofrecerles estos productos en sus oficinas, para ella es de mejor garantía porque son personas con ingresos fijos y siempre pagan su cuenta a tiempo, lo cual le conviene porque ella puede realizar sus compras a tiempo. Este trabajo le demanda de esfuerzo físico, por lo que Herlinda está planeando abrir un stand de cosméticos, por ello que desde ahora Herlinda está comunicando a sus clientes donde la ubicaran en el futuro. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MF, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite  ahorrar y conocer a personas solidarias. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos, de esa manera tener su propio stock.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 62 years old and lives with her 3 children in their own home. For 2 years she has been selling cosmetics, which she purchases from the principal beauty companies. Everyday she sells her products by visiting with her customers, showing them her catalogue of products, color samples, perfumes, etc.

In order to achieve more success in her sales Herlinda goes to the workers in different institutions to offer them her products in their offices. For her this the best guarantee because they are people with regular incomes and they always pay their bill on time, which is good for her because she can then make her purchases on time.

This job is very physically demanding, for this reason Herlinda is planning on opening a cosmetics stand. From now on Herlinda is communicating to her clients where her stand will be located in the future. This the second time that she has a loan with MF. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because it allows her to save and know supportive people. The money that she is soliciting will be invested in the purchase of more cosmetics so that she can have her own stock.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of her merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses y sus ventas están mejorando poco a poco, antes Ana vendía ropa en ferias y viajaba constantemente es por ello que dejo de realizar este negocio.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevo.
Los sueños de Ana es surtir su negocio, ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank. She is 28 years old, has two children and lives with her domestic partner. Ana has a store in a rented space where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit. She started this six months ago and her sales have been increasing little by little. Previously, she was selling clothing in markets and was traveling constantly which she gave up to start her current business. Ana needs a loan of 600 Sols that she will use to buy rice, sugar and eggs. Her dreams are to establish her business, save up to buy some land and to build herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Jossy

texts.es: Jossy tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Tiene su propio negocio de venta de jugos de frutas desde hace medio año, empezó con este negocio debido a un traspaso que le hizo uno de sus familiares. En la actualidad brinda su atención durante todo el día a su establecimiento porque está de vacaciones, pero cuando estudia, su madre la apoya con su negocio. Este año Jossy estudiará de noche para que todo el día esté abocada en su juguería, de ese modo podrá lograr la meta que se ha trazado de ser una buena profesional que administre una cadena de juguerías. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a ser parte del banco comunal que actualmente integra, además tiene muchas expectativas de ser un buen elemento integrador de su grupo. La cantidad requerida la invertirá en la compra de vitrinas y mostradores para mejorar la presencia de su local comercial.
texts.en:
Jossy is 21 years old and lives with her parents and her siblings in her parents' house. She has had her own business selling fruit juices for half a year. She got into this business by taking it over from a friend of hers. Currently she gives it her full attention all day long because she is on vacation, but when she is studying, her mother helps her with the business. This coming year, Jossy will be studying at night so that she can tend the shop all day long. That way she would be able to achieve the goal that she has drawn up to become a good professional at running a chain of juice stands. This is the first time she has applied for a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She was invited to become part of an existing communal bank but she also has high hopes of becoming an important part of her group. The requested funds will be used to buy display cases and counters to improve the appearance of her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cases.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace dos años se dedica al bordado de fustanes, su madre fue quien le enseñó a bordar cada técnica y detalle, que ahora le sirven para sostener su negocio y poco a poco destacarse como una de las mejores productoras de bordados manuales. Trabaja de manera independiente en las instalaciones de su casa todos los días, de preferencia por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas está más ocupada en las tareas del hogar. Sus pedidos se incrementan en épocas de festividades, Mayo y Junio, los demás meses tiene una demanda permanente. Liliana ha planeado mejorar su propio ambiente de trabajo, para seguir produciendo sus bellos bordados en un taller con todo lo necesario. Es la segunda que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de seguir adelante en su banco comunal, está trabajando para que su grupo siga unido. La cantidad que viene solicitando la invertirá en la compra de materiales básicos para la elaboración de sus bordados; comprará e hilos de diversos colores.
texts.en:
Liliana is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a rented home. For two years, she has been dedicated to embroidering "fustanes" (skirts worn for special occasions in her culture). Her mother was the person who taught every technique and detail of embroidery, which now helps her maintain her business and gradually stand out as one of the best producers of embroidery by hand. She works independently in her home every day, preferably in the afternoons since in the morning she is busy with housework. Her orders grow during festival months May and June. She's in constant demand for the rest of the year. Liliana has planned to improve her own working conditions in order to continue producing her beautiful embroidery in a shop that has everything necessary. This the second time getting a loan with MFP and she is very eager to move ahead with her community bank. She is working so that her group stays united. The amount that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of basic materials for her embriodery. She will buy thread in different colors.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her embroidery.

loans.name: Delia Rufina

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Delia es viuda, tiene 56 años y 5 hijos, Delia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hermana.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. delia son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank.
Delia is 56 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Delia has a stall in the 12 D. Abril market, where she sells food every day with her sister’s help.
Delia needs a 1000 soles loan to purchase rice and sugar. Delia dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 29 años, vive en casa de un familiar, con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 4 años vende artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante, ayudada por su esposo, llevando a ofrecer su mercadería a lugares lejanos de la zona rural de su localidad. La facilidad que otorga Nelly es que da al crédito y 15 días después regresa para cobrar y volver a vender. Lo que ofrece es de acuerdo a la ocasión, en esta época de frío le solicitaron frazadas, en época escolar le solicitan uniformes escolares, y otros diversos artículos. Para Nelly este trabajo es rentable, porque de cada producto que vende obtiene una ganancia razonable que justifica el esfuerzo que hacen ella y su esposo. Para le futuro Nelly desea ampliar su mercado, viajando a otros lugares a ofrecer su mercadería. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de continuar un trabajo unido con su banco comunal, su deseo es que se siga con este trabajo solidario a pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que se puedan presentar. El dinero que viene solicitando es para abastecerse de más artículos para el hogar, que son su capital de trabajo; en esta ocasión le solicitan útiles escolares, uniformes y ollas para la cocina.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old and lives in a relative's home with her husband and three children. For four years she has been selling household products on foot, assisted by her husband, offering her merchandise in far off places in her rural area. The benefit that Nelly grants is that she gives credit and, 15 days later, she returns to collect and sell again. What she offers to her customers depends on the occasion: in this cold season, her customers request blankets. In school season, they request school uniforms and other various articles. For Nelly, this work is profitable because she earns a reasonable profit with each product that she sells so it justifies the effort she and her husband put forth. For the future, Nelly wishes to grow her market, traveling to other places to offer her merchandise. This is the second time that she has taken a loan with MFP. She is very happy to continue a joint effort with her community bank. Her wish is that she continues this work despite difficult circumstances that might crop up. The money that she is requesting is to stock up on more household products which are her working capital. At this time, she is being asked for school supplies, uniforms and pots for the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Flora Idania

texts.es:
La microempresaria Flora Idania C. C. tiene 30 años de edad es casada con dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian en nivel primario y secundario. Esta joven madre se dedica a la administración de una pulpería que tiene en el barrio Santa Rosa de esta ciudad de Bluefields desde hace 4 años. Con este negocio aporta para el sustento diario de su hogar, ya que aunque su marido trabaja su salario no alcanza para todos los gastos.

Esta microempresaria habita en un sector en donde no existen muchas pulperías por lo cual le permite obtener buenas ventas, sin embargo las utilidades son pocas ya que no puede comprar los productos en cantidades, por tal razón necesita financiamiento para poder obtener a un menor precio las mercaderías y obtener mejores ganancias.

Requiere se le financie para comprar: 3 quintales de Arroz americano a US 64 cada quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar a US 30 cada quintal, 5 quintales de  harina a US 45 cada quintal, 5 bolsones de  papel higiénico a US 35 cada bolsón, 4 cajas de sopa maruchan a US 12 cada caja, 3 cajas de leche la lechera a US 45 cada caja  y 3 quintales de frijoles a US 45 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Micro-entrepreneur Flora Idania C. C. is 30 years old, married and has 2 young children who are studying at primary and secondary school. This young mother has run a small grocery store in the Santa Rosa neighbourhood in Bluefields for 4 years. This business helps her provide for her family; although her husband works, his salary is not enough to cover all their expenses

Since this micro-entrepreneur lives in an area where there aren’t many grocery stores, her sales are good. However, her profits are small since she isn’t able to purchase products in large quantities. She needs this loan to get merchandise at a lower price and to make better profits.

She is requesting this loan to purchase: 3 quintals of American rice at $64 each, 3 quintals of sugar at $30 each, 5 quintals of flour at $45 each, 5 packages of toilet paper at $35 each, 4 cases of instant soup at $12 each, 3 cases of La Lechera milk at $45 each and 3 quintals of beans at $45 each.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour, toilet paper, instant soup, milk and beans.

loans.name: 28 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 28 D. Noviembre inicia su sexto ciclo con 15 Socias. Las socias son del Distrito D. Acosvinchos que se ubica a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, calzados, cochinilla, tara, comidas, carnes, cereales, frutas y la fabricación D. tejas.

Como es el caso D. Carmen que es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. tejas, el quemado D. las tejas lo realiza en el horno D. sus suegros.

Por otro lado Victoria es casada, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos, Victoria se dedica a la venta D. carne en la feria D. su distrito, los animales los adquiere en los diferentes pueblos.

Mientras que Laurentina es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Laurentina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras. Además se dedica al pelado del maíz, producto que comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 9,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azucar, carne, frutas, leña, animales y el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son educar a sus hijos, ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena alimentación.
texts.en:
The 28th of November Communal Bank starts its sixth cycle with 15 members. The members are from the Acosvinchos district which is located one hour from the city of Ayacucho. The members operate different businesses such as the sale of general groceries, footwear, suckling pigs, tara plant, food, meat, cereal grains, fruit, and the weaving of fabric.

For example, take the case of Carmen who lives with her partner, is 29 years old and has three children. She and her husband dedicate themselves to the manufacture of bricks, the firing of which she accomplishes in the oven of her in-laws.

On the other hand is Victoria who is married, 33 years old, and has five children. She dedicates herself to the sale of meat in the street market of her district, acquiring the animals in different towns.

Meanwhile, there is Laurentina who lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has two children. Laurentina has a stO. in her home where she sells groceries and vegetables. FurthermO., she dedicates herself to the blanching of corn, a product which she sells in the city Ayacucho.

The members need different amounts of loans such as 300 PEN, 450 PEN, 600 PEN, for a total loan of 9,950 PEN from the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, meat, fruit, firewood, animals, and the payment of laborers. The dreams of the members are to educate their children, grow their businesses, and to proviD. a good diet.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, meat, fruit, firewood, animals, and the payment of laborers.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 52 años, es madre de 8 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro. A lado de su pareja, tratan de brindarles los mejores cuidados, pues hace 30 años compraron una casa donde vive toda la familia unida. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo, quien es carpintero, para ayudarlo en los trabajos que realiza tuvo que aprender algo de esta labor que en un inicio era complicada, pero con el paso de los años fue mejorando, pues su pareja la ayudó con las cosas fundamentales y así juntos estan dedicados a brindar su servicio de diseño en madera de  diversos objetos. El detalle es que  ambos no se dan abasto para el trabajo y requieren el apoyo de una tercera persona, pues la actividad de Dina está tornándose administrativa y requiere atender los pedidos de los clientes. Los 16 años de dedicarse a la carpintería la están agotando, y Dina espera que sus hijos sean el apoyo para su padre y ella poder instalar un negocio para vender dentro de su hogar. Ella viene trabajando con MFP hace 10 años, y ésta en su solicitud número 29, es una de las socias fundadoras de su banco comunal, y en transcurso de su permanencia vio pasar a muchas personas, pero siempre trató de mantener unido al grupo para lograr organización que no solo rinda crédito, sino que brinde oportunidades a las personas. Su préstamo de 1700 soles será invertido en la compra de materia prima necesaria para la producción de muebles que tienen que entregar con prontitud.
texts.en:
Dina is 52 years old and the mother of eight children who are her greatest treasure. Together with her husband, they try to provide the best care, so 30 years ago they bought a house where the entire family lives, united. She works together with her husband, who is a carpenter, to help him in his work. She realized she had to learn something about this work which at first was complicated, but improved with the passage of the years as her husband helped her with the fundamentals. Together they are dedicated to providing their service of designing diverse wood products.

The issue is that the two of them are not sufficient for the amount of work and they require the help of a third person so that Dina’s activities can become administrative and attending to customer requests. The 16 years that they have dedicated to carpentry is wearing them out, and Dina hopes that her children will become the support of her husband and that she can make a business in the home for selling their products.

Dina has been working with MFP for ten years, is making her 29th loan request, and is a founding member of the communal bank. In the course of her membership, she has seen the coming and going of many people, but she has always tried to keep the group united to achieve an organization that not only provides credit, but also provides opportunities to people. Her loan of 1700 PEN will be invested in the purchase of premium material necessary for the production of furniture that they have to deliver promptly.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta es muy trabajadora y dulce, es madre soltera, pero eso no la limitó en proveer de lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos, a quienes no solo brindo un lugar para vivir sino que los educó haciendo de ellos jóvenes con preparación y valores. El duro papel de ser madre y padre para sus hijos la llenó de vitalidad, porque sin esa necesidad no hubiera logrado tener un puesto dónde vender sus platos de comida, ni los desayunos en los  mercados, pues desde que se separó inicio su trabajo, vendiendo en las calles y preparando algunos bocaditos, pero con el tiempo tuvo el proyecto de vender comida en los mercados y gracias a las sociedad que realizó con su hermana, con quien unió esfuerzos, abrieron un puesto de comida en el mercado de su localidad. Este trabajo la mantiene muy ocupada, pero contenta,  ya que sus anhelos y deseos lograron realizarse, basta seguir esforzándose para hacer de su negocio el mejor. Enriqueta tiene planeado independizarse y conseguir un local propio para  obtener mayores ingresos con el fin de terminar de educar a sus hijos. Su tiempo de permanencia en MFP es de 5 años, esta temporada la han ido ayudando a mejorar sus relaciones sociales y a contribuir en el desarrollo de las personas, pues como presidenta de su banco comunal ha estado impulsando y alentando a las socias a crecer en su economía. El  crédito de 1000 soles que solicita le será muy útil para la compra de vitrinas y otros muebles que requiere su puesto.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is very hardworking and sweet. She is a single mother, but that hasn't stopped her from providing for her four children, whom she not only provided a place to live, but also educated from their youth with morals. This tough role of being mother and father to her children filled her with vitality because without that she would not have succeeded in her work, selling meals and breakfasts at the markets. When she began her work she sold sandwiches in the streets, but over time has come to selling food at the markets, thanks to working with her sister, with whom she joined forces and opened a booth at the local market. This work keeps her very busy, but happy, now that her dreams have been realized so that she can make her business better. Enriqueta plans to become independent and have her own business location so that she can increase her revenue and finish paying for her children's school. She has been with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma for five years, and as president of her communal bank has been inspiring and encouraging her fellow bank members to expand in the economy. This loan of 1000 soles will be very useful for buying display cases and other furniture needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor motivo para desarrollarse y brindarles lo necesario para sus cuidados y educación. Ella trata de estar en casa el tiempo que  sus hijos requieren de su compañía. Siempre que pueda dedicarse a diversas actividades que no le cohíban  de la compañía de sus hijos trata de  aprovecharlas al máximo, hace 5 años estuvo dedicándose a ayudar a una señora en la venta de comida, pero en el transcurso, fue aprendiendo y obtuvo experiencia, que le facilitó iniciar su propio negocio. Por el momento tiene un socio con quien viene trabajando 6 meses y juntos tratan de hacer rentable este nuevo proyecto. Sin embargo, ella tiene el sueño de tener un restaurante propio para no compartir las ganancias, ya que requiere mucho más ingresos económicos para la educación de sus hijos. Pero hasta no lograr mayor rentabilidad, debe ir poco a poco y con el tiempo logrará conseguir sus anhelos. El tiempo que está dentro de MFP es de 4 años y dentro de su banco comunal que tuvo sus inicios años atrás, cuando aun no conocía de una institución de crédito, pero cuando encontró esta oportunidad optó por ser parte del grupo, donde las socias son muy amables y el trabajo que realizan es muy coordinado, pero con algunos problemas como toda organización. El crédito de 600 soles la ayudará en la compra de mercadería para la preparación de los alimentos, los cuales son sumamente naturales, con el fin de brindar comida de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 40, married, and has two children. Her children are her biggest motivation to succeed because she wants to provide them with the necessities for their care and education. She tries to be at home when her children need her there. Whenever she can, she is involved in activities that allow her to be with her children. She helped a lady sell food for 5 years. During this time she was learning and gaining experience. This facilitated the start of her own business. She has been working with a partner for 6 months. Together they try to make their new project profitable. However, she has the dream of having her own restaurant so that she will not have to share the profits. She needs more income for her children’s education. But until she achieves greater profitability, she needs to take it slow. With time her business will be more profitable, and she will reach her goals. She has been with MFP for 4 years. She is a member of her community bank which started a few years ago when she did not even know about lending institutions. When she heard of this opportunity, she chose to be part of the group where the members are friendly. The work they do is very coordinated, but they do have some problems like all organizations. The loan is for 600 PEN ($200). She will buy supplies for preparing her all natural food and be able to offer quality food to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía Ríos Núñez es casada y de su matrimonio procrearon un hijo.
Ellos viven  en una casa de interés social cuando ellos adquirieron  su vivienda se la entregaron sin vitropiso, ella  ha  querido ponérselo  pero siempre ha tenido prioridades económicas como lo han sido las necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y salud de sus hijos. Ella siempre y su esposo han preferido darle lo mejor educación a sus hijos para que en un futuro tenga un profesión pero como también quiere dejarles un patrimonio el cual quiere es su vivienda y darle mantenimiento para esto nenecita capital para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofía Ríos Núñez is married and has a son. They live in subsidized housing. When they acquired their home they were given it without a tile floor. She has wanted to put one in but she has always had other economic priorities like basic food needs, education and health of her children. She and her husband have always wanted to provide the best education for their children so that in the future they have a profession and would also like to provide them an inheritance in their home and provide maintenance. The loan will be used to finish this project.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glazed tile flooring

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luís A. vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos el trabaja como mesero en un restaurante-bar de la ciudad, el ingreso que el percibe por este trabajo no es muy alto, lo que ayuda a la economía de esta familia son las propinas que dejan los clientes, al paso del los años el Señor Carlos ha construido un patrimonio para su familia con ahorros propios. Primero el compro un terreno y empezó a fincar en el, a horita el tiene la obra detenida por falta de materiales y dinero para pago de mano de obra por lo que el nos solicita ayuda para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Luís A. lives with his wife and four children. He works as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. The income he receives for this work is not very high, what helps his family economically are the tips that his customers leave him. Over the years Carols has built an inheritance for his family with his own savings. First he bought a plot of land and began farming it. Now he has stopped work because he is lacking materials and money to pay the laborers so he is asking us for a loan to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and labor for construction

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen R. V. es viuda trabaja para una empresa que le da servicio a las maquiladoras de limpieza desempeña un trabajo como afanadora, la casa en la que vive la señora Maria tiene el techo de lamina y hace un par de meses con un aire muy fuerte que se vino se le voló el techo. Pero en ese momento ella no contaba con dinero suficiente para poder reparar el daño y lo que hizo fue ponerle piedras grandes para que el peso no permitiera que volviera a suceder. La señora Carmen comento que no quiere dejarlo así ya que entre mas pase el tiempo pueda suceder que se vuele alguna lámina y causar alguna desgracia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Carmen R. V. is a widow. She works for a business that provides repairs to cleaning equipment. She works as a cleaning woman. Maria’s home has a laminate roof and a couple months ago a very strong wind came and her roof flew off. But today she doesn’t have enough money to be able to repair the damage and what she has done it put large stones on her roof so that this wouldn’t happen again. Carmen commented that she doesn’t want to let it like this because as more time passes it could happen again that the laminate could fly off and cause some damage.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene L. R. es soltero, y comenta que desde un año hubo recorte de personal en la maquiladora que el trabajo y el fue uno de las personas que liquidaron. Con el dinero que le dieron de la liquidación el prefirió en invertir en un negocio de abarrotes y esta funcionando muy bien, solo que el desea tener una tienda bien surtida, con variedad para que haya de todo tipos de articulo  para no perder clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene L. R. is single and he says that a year ago there were job cuts in the factory where he works and he was one of the people they left go. With the money that they gave him with the termination he preferred to invest it in a grocery business and this is going very well, although he wishes to have a well-stocked store with a variety of items so that there are all kinds of items so as not to lose customers and meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Mr. Top Y., 58, makes a living as an ox trader. He usually sells oxen that he buys from villagers and resells for profit. His wife sells beef and some fresh fish in the local market. They have seven children, four of them are single and are fishermen. They all live in Preksdey Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. This is the seventh cycle of loan with HKL and the second cycle of loan with Kiva.

Top Y. used the first cycle of loan to buy oxen to sell and he has supported his family's expenses sufficiently. With the second cycle of loan, he will buy additional oxen for sale and some fishing tools for his children's businesses. (Top Y.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy additional oxen for sale

loans.name: In

texts.en: Almost one hectare of the village land and a wooden house in Pursat Province belong to Mrs. In M. and six other family members. She, 56, earns a living cultivating rice and raising pigs in a small pigpen next to her house. She has been farming for years, a skill she learned from her grandparents who have now been dead for a long time. Her husband helps her with her business activities. The old couple have nine children; five of them are single and the others are married and live independently. Two of their single children are employed. Because the farming season is approaching, the family needs to have cows and some fertilizers for their farming business, and this is why they are applying for a loan. They plan to use half of the loan to repair their house.

loans.use: To buy cows, fertilizers, and to repair their house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and manages a sari-sari store (a community based store) in their village. She sells different commodities and vegetables in front of her store. Her business is already ten years old and it has been their alternative source of income when they run out of budget from the income of her husband who works as a seaman.  Her business has been a great help in sending her children to school. To maintain her business, Sonia would like to request a loan of PHP5,000 for the development of her business. She really hopes that her loan request will be granted so she can support her family and the educational needs of her children.  

She is married to Dante and they have two children who are: Patrick Lenard - 17 years old, 3rd year high school; and Sarah Mae - 16 years old, college freshman.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia S. has operated a small sari-sari store (community based store) in their village for many years, which has supported her family. Aside from her store, she is also engaged in the poultry business. At present, Arsenia wants to request a loan of PHP9,000 to further support and expand her two small businesses. She hopes that she can save money for her family so they can have something to use in case of emergency.  

Arsenia is married to Rolly Sr. and they live in Barangay Rizal in Santiago City. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter. The couple has two children: Aileen - 32 years old, a high school graduate; and Rolly Jr. - 31 years old, college graduate who works as a security guard. Arsenia is thankful that she was blessed with a good husband and children.

loans.use: Business Support and Expansion

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a dealer of Boardwalk products for men, women and kids. In order to purchase more products to sell, she would like to request a loan of PHP6,000 that she will use as a down payment for her merchandise. She also hopes to expand her business and sell AVON, NATASHA and MSE products to further develop her direct selling skills and to support the education of her children and graduate from college.  

Margie is married to Marcelino Jr. and they have two children: Princes Erika – 6 years old, pre-school student; and Michaela – 2 years old.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica M. is 35 years old and married to Chester, a policeman assigned to Bulacan, which is approximately seven hours from their place. The couple was blessed with three children: Chesca - 4 years old; Jester - 2 years old; and the youngest Frena Mae - 1 month old. She hopes to give her children a better education in the future and raise them with good values, even though her husband works far away from them.  

Jessica operates a tricycle transport business that one of her relatives drives, and then gives her a daily boundary (like a rent for the tricycle) of PHP200.00. Jessica would like to venture into another business like selling frozen food to increase her income. Thus, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP8,000 since her income from her tricycle is just enough to meet their daily needs. She prays that her request loan will be approved so that she will be able to save money to support her children’s education in the future.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance and to start a new business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn E. is a resident in the village of Rizal in Santiago City. She is 30 years old and married to Ronal who works as a security guard. The couple was blessed with two healthy children: Ardie - 9 years old, presently in elementary level; and Angelo - 6 years old, also in elementary level.  

Arlyn manages her own village store and she has been in this business for less than a month. She is hoping to improve her business by seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP4, 000. She plans to use her loan to purchase stock in bulk for her store. 

She is so excited to see developments in her business. She believes that through hard work and patience, she will be able to sustain her business for a long time. She is thankful that her husband is very supportive and their children also do well in their studies, thus Arlyn is inspired to work harder.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn helps her husband in their hollow block and baluster (pre-cast) making business. Aside from this, they also maintain a fish pond that supports the immediate needs of their family. She would like to sustain their small businesses and with this in mind, she would like to borrow a loan from the lenders of PHP5,000. She hopes that through her business, they can have a progressively better life in the future. She and her husband will do their best to succeed in business and provide a better life for their family.  

Marvelyn is 49 years old and married to Gualberto. The couple was blessed with two children: Neil Alvin - 23 years old, college graduate; and Allen Pearl Kris - 11 years old, elementary student. She wishes to see her children live a successful life someday and have a better way of life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en: Mayleen Abobo is twenty-eight years old and has one daughter.  She lives in San Jose, the capital of beautiful Antique Province.  Her husband Rodelin is a "tricycle" taxi driver -- a rickshaw-like motorcycle with a sidecar that can carry people and cargo.  Mayleen runs a sari-sari shop and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy inventory for her store.  "Sari-sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and the shops sell an assortment of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities.  The shops tend to retail items in small units -- selling single cigarettes, for example. Sari-sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in poor or rural areas; they often have chairs or a bench out front and act as neighborhood watering holes.  Mayleen has had her store for two years, and wants to upgrade it to carry more groceries.  She hopes to earn enough income to pay for her daughter's education, and would like her daughter to go to a university some day.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small variety store.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe E. is fifty-five years old and the mother of two. She resides in a mountain part of their village, Calacja, Hamtic, Antique, on the island of Panay. Her husband is a laborer. She buys and resells vegetables to support the needs of the family. Two years ago, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start a business. She applied for this loan to buy assorted foods in order to supply her variety store. Ma. Fe's income was used to finance the education of her child who is in elementary school. With her new venture, she has helped her neighbors.  She hopes that in the future, she can expand her business, build a better house and be able send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru:
Артыков Абдучаббор мужчина 49 лет, женат имеет шестерых детей, сам по специальности строитель .кроме своего основного дохода он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него 30 коз и пять больших коров. В день мониторинга скот отсутствовал, они были на пастбищах. Поэтому не удалось запечатлеть на фото вместе со скотом. Абдучаббор мужчина , который очень хорошо разбирается в породистых скотах.
По моральному облику видно , что займ будет использован действительно для увеличения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Abdujabbor A. is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has six children. By profession, he is a builder, but to supplement his main income, he raises and sells livestock. At present he has 30 goats and five large cows. On the day we visited, the livestock were not there. As they were out to pasture, it was not possible to photograph him together with his cattle. Abdujabbor has an excellent understanding of purebred cattle and is a man of character who will truly use this loan to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sale of cattle

loans.name: Nosir

texts.ru: Носир мужчина 31 года , женат имеет двоих детей, работает в колхозе на поле .Занимается поливом урожая. Кроме этой работы он имеет доход на проживание с бизнеса животноводства. У него 35 коз и баранов , в сезон дешёвого скота, Носир хочет закупить скот в кредит. Его жена занимается продажей пряжи шерсти собственных коз.Для получения кредита Носир обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Nosir is a 31-year-old man, who is married and has two children. He works in the fields on a collective farm, handling irrigation of the crops. In addition to this work, he makes a living raising livestock and has 35 goats and sheep. As cattle are cheap at present, Nosir wants to purchase cattle on credit. His wife sells wool yarn from their own goats. Nosir has turned to MicroInvest for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Hamzali

texts.ru: Хамзали мужчина 45 лет , женат имеет четверых детей. Работает в сельском совете секретарём и помощником председателя сельсовета. Хамзали второй раз решил кредитоваться и увеличить свой скот в кредит. После первого займа у него скот увеличился, а также он отремонтировал свой хлев. Теперь в этот раз Хамзали хочет закупить породистых баранов. которых откормив он будет резать и продавать за хорошую цену, Т.к  таджикский народ любит мясо баранины.
texts.en:
Hamzali is a 45 year old man, he is married and has four children. He works as a secretary for the village council and as an assistant to the chairman of the village council. Hamzali has decided to take out a loan for the second time and to increase his livestock headcount via a loan. After the first loan his livestock count increased and he also repaired his barn. This time, Hamzali would like to purchase lambs that he will raise and then butcher and sell at a good price, since Tajik people love lamb meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lambs

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат 50 лет, замужем имеет 5 детей. Она продает хозяйственными товарами. Ее товар, это кипятильники,  батареи, лампочки и туалетные бумаги. Она торгует 10 лет. Ее магазин находиться среди ряда хозяйственного товара. Торговля идет с 8 утра до 5 вечера.С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2007 года. Кредит получает на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shafoat is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. She sells household products. Her products include water boilers, batteries, light bulbs and toilet paper. She has been a saleswoman for 10 years. Shafoat’s store is located in the middle of a row of household products. Sales occur from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. Shafoat has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She is taking out a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Kambarali

texts.ru: Камбарали мужчина 32 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка. Камбарали работает в колхозе трактористом на поле. Из-за того, за работу ему дают не деньги , а продукты, то поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ему друзья посоветовали увеличить скот в кредит. Для чего и обратился Камбарали в Микроинвест. Он думает, что в дальнейшем он будет продолжать кредитоваться .
texts.en:
Kambarali is a 32 year old man, he is married and has one child. Kambarali works at a collective farm as a tractor driver in the field. He gets paid in kind for his work and is not given any money, so he also raises and sells livestock. His friends suggested that he increase his livestock headcount by taking out a loan. This is why Kambarali turned to MicroInvest. He thinks that he will continue taking out loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa manages a small store in her village. She is planning to continue her business to support the education of her two children. Evangeline is twenty-four years old and a fourth year nursing student. May is twelve and an elementary student.  Elsa is fofty-four years old and can be described as a responsible mother and a good wife to Guillermo. 

She wanted to purchase more merchandise for her store, especially now that peak season is approaching.  She hopes to buy different commodities such as soft drinks, breads, biscuits and other items that are in demand during harvest season.  This is the reason why Elsa would like to borrow $100 to support her enterprise.  She hopes that her loan request will be granted and that she may achieve her goals someday.

loans.use: Business Support

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is forty-nine years old and lives in beautiful Pandan, a coastal city on the Sulu Sea located in the north part of Antique Province.  She is married to Eduardo, a construction worker, and has three sons, ages thirteen, sixteen and eighteen.  Her youngest son is still in high school, and her two older sons are high school graduates who now work as laborers.
Julieta has two income-generating ventures: she weaves pandan leaves into hats and sleeping mats, and she retails rice.  Pandan is a palm-like plant that has many species, and Julieta's city is said to have derived its name from the plant.  Mats made of pandan, known as "banig" in Tagalog, are a famous handicraft of the area; sometimes the mats are woven plain, and at other times the raw materials are dyed and woven into mats with colorful geometrical patterns.
Julieta plans to use the money from this loan disbursed by one of Kiva's field partners, ASHI, to buy raw materials for weaving, and rice for resale.  She says that her participation in ASHI programs has helped her build confidence in herself and in her business skills.  She would like to earn enough so she can afford to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving, and to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Nguen Thi

texts.en:
Nguen Thi H. is forty-eight years old and started with the Kiva partner, TYM, in 1999. She and her husband have three children who are twenty-one, twenty-four and twenty-six years old and are all grown up. 
Because of TYM’s workshops, where people learn what to raise and grow, Mrs. H. decided to raise chickens and pigs.  She also grows rice. For this she needed a first loan of $85, which she got from TYM. 
Because of her success at running her business, she has a monthly income of $112.  Unfortunately, that isn’t enough to live on, so she is reliant on the financial help of her children. With the next loan through Kiva, which is $575, she hopes to stop this economic dependence on her children by improving her raising possibilities (built a bigger cote) and by buying animal feed.

loans.use: Improving of raising possibilities

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru: Хайдаров Хомид мужчина , который торгует на рынке сахаром и конфетами. Для увеличения товара он решил получить параллельный займ. Сейчас поступил дешёвый сахар, который и хочет закупить Хомид. Он говорит, что через месяц в сезон варенья сахар подоражает,и ему будет выгодно его продать.
texts.en:
Homid H. is a man who sells sugar and candy at the market. In order to increase his stock he decided to take out a parallel loan. Right now cheap sugar is available and Homid would like to purchase it. He says that jam season will start in a month and sugar will become more expensive, making it profitable for him to sell it.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar for sale

loans.name: Winjy

texts.en: Winjy P., a 29-year-old mother of three, lives in the beautiful town of Culasi, Antique. Culasi is located along the sea, and fishing is its main source of income. Gary, Winjy's husband, owns a small fishing boat. Winjy sells her husband's catch in the village and in nearby towns. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) a year ago to get capital for a grocery store. She's applying for this loan to buy assorted goods to sustain her business. Winjy hopes that she can cater to the needs of her neighbors and wants to maintain her regular costumers. She hopes that in the future she can make improvements to her grocery store and save more money so she can send her young children to school.

loans.use: To buy assorted goods for her store.

loans.name: Zanased

texts.en: Zanased P. lives with his wife in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Zanased has three grown-up children. His two daughters live independently and work, while his youngest son is a college student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Zanased was trained to make products with wrought iron. When the state-owned firm he worked for went bankrupt during the economic crisis of 1990, which occurred because of Mongolia's transition away from communism, he was laid off. Since then, he started his own business making household products from wrought iron. He started his business with 200,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,500 MNT) of capital, and his business capital has now grown to 3,000,000 MNT. He hopes to one day have a workshop to make his products and to be able to meet all the iron-product needs of his town. He requests a loan to purchase supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his business

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren G. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His three children study in local high schools. With his wife, he runs a small family business in wood processing and transportation. In 1995, he initially started his business by making wooden furniture for local clients. However, as he realized that there was a better money to be made in wood processing and transportation, he switched his business focus in 2007. He transports trees from local forests and processes them for carpenter's use. Business is going well, and he was able to repair and modernize his truck with his profits. He aims to supply all the processed wood for the local carpenters. He requests a loan to purchase trees and new tires for his truck. He hopes to be able to afford university education for his children. In the picture: Lhagvasuren's wife Altantsetseg in their business field.

loans.use: To purchase trees and new tires for his truck.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn C. is a young business woman who perseveres a lot in order to have a progressive life. She is 23 years old and manages a hog raising business. Aside from that, she also engages in direct selling to further support the feed supply of her hogs.

She strives so hard so she can help her parents send her other siblings to school. Now, for the continuous operation of her small enterprises, she requests a loan of PHP 4,000 for additional business capital. She is very optimistic that she will become successful in the business even though there are many competitors.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Batsayhan

texts.en:
Batsayhan S. lives with his wife and two children in Arhangay province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His wife stays home and takes care of the children. In her free time, she works as a tailor to earn extra income for the family. Batsayhan herds about 120 head of livestock. 

Livestock tend to sell cheaply in the spring, when they've been weakened by the harsh Mongolian winter; thus, Batsayhan would like to buy more livestock at this time of year. He will then feed and herd them until the fall comes, when the price of livestock skyrockets. In the meantime, his family uses the milk of the livestock and makes dairy products for their own use. 

Batsayhan dreams of one day receiving the state honor given to herders with 1,000 livestock. With this loan, he will purchase more livestock to increase his herd.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to increase his herd.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 24-year-old young man living in Burj Barajneh, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a printing shop in his village for the past five years. Today, Wassim is requesting to borrow $1200 to buy a new photocopier for his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopier.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana P. is 56 years old and has 4 children. Her husband, Melchor P., is a farmer. Victoriana owns a small sari-sari store (local convenience shop). She started her business using their small savings of PHP 5000. Aside from selling a variety of goods, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. Victoriana wants to send all her children to college so that when they are older they can support their families well. 

Victoriana wishes to grow her store and needs capital to buy additional merchandise. She is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000. She will use the loan to improve her store and also to get a start in other businesses. The loan will truly help her family grow their business.

Kiva partner CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and grow their own businesses. They give not only credit, but training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 50-year-old woman living in Ras Al Nabaa in Beirut. She has been working as a tailor since 1973 and she provides her sewing services to the suburban towns. Today Amina is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to buy a new sewing machine to increase her output.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфузе 29 лет, она не замужем. Торгует мелкими игрушками и материалами. Сейчас она торгует тапочками. Ее  родители раньше торговали вместо нее. Сейчас она сама научилась продавать , поэтому родители передали  свой бизнес. Она закончила 10 классов средней школы. Поступать в университет не решилась так как надо иметь большие деньги на поступление и за обучение. В Микроинвест обратилась что бы увеличить свой капитал и расширить ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is 29 years old, she is not married. She sells small toys and other products. Right now she sells slippers. Previously her parents sold products with her. Now she has learned how to sell products on her own and her parents passed on their business to her. Dilfuza finished 10 school grades. She decided not to attend university because that would require a lot of money for admission and tuition. She has turned to MicroInvest to increase her capital and increase her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and product assortment

loans.name: Nguen Thi

texts.en:
Nguen Thi M’ai, 39 years old, started with TYM Fund in 2000. She and her husband have four children, ages 3, 14, 16 and 19 years old. With the help of TYM, all the children are able to go to school.

The story of the M’ai family begins in 2000. With a TYM loan of 700 VND ($40) , Mrs. M’ai bought some chickens and expanded her business. With the increased earnings, her husband was able to learn carpentry in Hanoi. Today, he and his wife own a successful carpentry business with 6 employees. Their income has increased from 1 million VND to 7 million VND per month ($395).

With the next loan of 20 million VND, Mrs. M’ai wants to invest in buying pigs and Mr. M’ai wants to buy some new wood. If everything works out well, maybe Mr. M’ai could even buy a new motorbike next year. This is a wish he has had for a long time and which would have been inconceivable for him 10 years ago.

loans.use: Buying pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of the sari-sari store

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is a 47-year-old woman, living in Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. She started as a home based tailor five years ago and in 2007 she opened her first shop in her home village. Today, Noura is requesting to borrow $1,100 in order for her to buy new sewing machines to increase her output. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and continue her growing success.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek is a 42 year-old married man with two children living in Adloun in southern Lebanon. He currently works at the butcher shop he opened 16 years ago. Today, Malek wants to borrow $1,000 in order to introduce new meat into his shop to serve all his clientele.

loans.use: introducing new meat into his shop

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hassan is a 33-year-old married man with one child, living in Al Mghayrieh. He has owned a carpentery shop since 2000. Today, Hassan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase equipments for his job.	 He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: purchase equipments

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 21-year-old young woman living in Al Mghayrieh in Mount Lebanon. She produces plastic bags for a local chocolate factory. She has been in this business since 2001. Today, Samar is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy decorative inventory in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy decorative inventory

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат парень 22 лет , пока не женат проживает вместе с родителями.Работает моляром автомашин.Раньше при первом займе он вёл свою деятельность в городском гараже по ремонту автомашин.Теперь научившись своему делу , он решил отделится и начать работать самому.Сейчас он работает на дому.Для покупки аппарата для покраски машин он решил повторно подать заявку на займ.Первый займ он использовал для покупки набора ключей, приборов для ремонта моторов автомашин. Шавкат благодарен , сто в кредит возможно расширить своё дело.
texts.en:
Shavkat is a 22 year old young man, for now he is not married and lives with his parents. Shavkat works as a car painter. Previously during his first loan he had his business at the public auto shop. Now, having learned his craft he decided to start his own business and work on his own. He works at home. In order to purchase a special apparatus to paint cars he decided to apply for a second loan. He used his first loan in order to purchase tools to repair auto engines. Shavkat is grateful that he can expand his business with the help of a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tool to paint cars

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina B. is a 34 year old woman who owns a bakery. She is a single parent with one child. "Life is really a test", she said. She is doing well in her business. She wants to expand in order to pay for school and other necessities.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to buy additional ingredients of bread in her bakery and merchandise for her store. This loan will help her expand her business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor to start and maintain their own business. CEVI gives their clients credit, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise in her store

loans.name: Bat-Orshih

texts.en: Bat-Orshih D. has a family of five and lives in Arhanghai, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a high school teacher and lives away from her parents. His second-oldest daughter is a college student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently, Bat-Orshih lives with his wife and his youngest daughter, who is a local high school student. Bat-Orshih started a small carpentry business in 1990, with just 40,000 MNT of capital ($1 USD=1,500 MNT). He makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, beds, and tables. His clients are mostly from the town where he lives. As the business expands, he would like to acquire more clients from neighboring towns in the province. In the future, he hopes to continue to be able to afford his daughters' college tuition. He requests a loan to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 32 year old married man with one child, living in Awkar, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a home painter since 2000. Today, Charles is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new painting equipment for his job.

loans.use: buy new painting equipment

loans.name: Bayasgalantogoldor

texts.en: Bayasgalantogoldor B. lives with his mother in Arhanghay province in one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His mother is 70 years old and retired. He runs a small carpentry business in his province. At the request of his clients, he makes wooden furniture, such as tables, chairs and beds. Although he is deaf, he is a talented carpenter. He has lived with his mother for over 20 years and receives a small state benefit provided to disabled citizens. Since the benefit money is not adequate for their needs, he started his small carpentry business. In the future, he hopes to have a stable carpentry business and be able to fully support his mother and himself with his business. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood and to replace his old table saw so he can cut wood more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase wood and to replace old table saw.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa F. sells fish in her village. She is 34 years old and has 1 child. Her husband is a fisherman and he feeds their family with the fish that he catches. She plans to have a permanent stall for her fish selling business. With her loan she will expand her business and make new income to support her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish from other fisherman.

CEVI helps fish vendors like Alfonsa by giving their clients credit, training and insurance coverage to make their small businesses grow.

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en: B. Anhtuya is 37 years old and a married mother of one daughter. She has one daughter who goes to elementary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and auto-mechanic. She has been running a dairy sales business since 2003. She had been selling milk, "airag" (fermented mare's milk, a Mongolian delicacy), yogurt and other dairy products by going door to door in her neighborhood. When she started running her small business, her capital was only 100,000 tugrigs ($1 USD=1,500 tugrigs). But with time and persistence her business has grown, and she in 2006 started renting a food stall at the local market. Her business capital has increased to 800,000 tugrigs. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more dairy products from wholesalers to increase her business inventory. Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional person and have a rich and happy life.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products from wholesalers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros F. is 34 years old and lives in Culasi, a beautiful coastal town in northern Antique Province on the island of Panay.  She has an 11 year old daughter and is married to Gregorio, a laborer.  Milagros has run a sari-sari store for about seven years.
"Sari-sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and the shops sell just that: an assortment of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. The shops retail items in small units -- selling single cigarettes, for example. Sari-sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in poor or rural areas; they often have chairs or a bench out front, and act as neighborhood gathering places.
Milagros will use most of the money from this loan to buy inventory for her store such as candy, shampoo, and noodles.  With the remainder of the loan she will buy a hog to nourish and intends to reinvest the profit she makes from the pig back into her sari-sari store.  If she earns enough, Milagros wants to be able to continue supporting her daughter's education and would like to make improvements to her house in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages as inventory for a small variety store and to buy one hog to nourish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda R. is a 55 year old mother of three. She works very hard to save money for her daughters’ education. However, only her eldest daughter graduated from college and landed a job. Her second daughter marriaged early and has kids, while her youngest daughter stops her studies when she's in primary school. Her husband is a fishpond caretaker. She acquired her knowledge in making Chinese steamed buns when Angeline, her eldest daughter, introduced the procedures. She was able to improve the cooking recipes to meet her customers varied taste; the business has been extremely successful. She applied for this loan to buy ingredients such as bread, flour, refined sugar, brown sugar, yeast, plastics, pork, and potatoes. She needs to buy those stocks in bulk in order to get a cheaper price. She hopes that she will be able to cope up her orders and make a stall out of her income. She hopes to build a working place and employ some of her neighbor in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingedients for Chinese steamed buns (siopao).

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
D. Françoise est âgée de 55 ans et elle est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Françoise est mère de cinq (5) enfants dont trois (3) garçons et deux (2) filles, tous majeurs. Françoise vit avec trois de ses petits fils dans sa propre maison à Kowegbo un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Françoise vendait des liqueurs (boissons alcoolisées) au marché Tokpa (marché international du Bénin); mais par la suite, Françoise a abandonné le marché et a créé une petite boutique de divers (bombons, biscuits,  sucre, pâtes alimentaires, savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) et de liqueurs (boissons alcoolisées) à un carrefour situé à près de 1 Km de son domicile. Françoise veut agrandir et diversifier ses activités. C'est dans cette optique que Françoise sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour pouvoir renforcer ces activités.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Françoise D., 55, comes from Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. Françoise is the mother of 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters, all adults. Françoise lives with three of her grand-sons in her own home in Kowegbo, a working-class neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin.

Françoise used to sell alcoholic drinks at the Tokpa market (the international market of Bénin); however, later, she left the market and opened up a little variety store selling candy, cookies sugar, pasta, detergents, dishwashing liquid, toilet soap, etc., but also alcoholic drinks on a crossroads situated about 1 km from her home.

Françoise wants to expand and diversify her business. It is with this in mind that she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to bolster her businesses.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has been selling car parts and accessories for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and other people from his region. Mahmoud hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru:
Султонова Ульмас женщина 48 лет, замужем  имеет троих детей. Проживает в районе Утконсой , в кишлаке Кизилблок. Она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей крупного скота, а также и мелкого, т.е. коз. Она сама в основном занимается производством пряжи и её продажей на рынке. Во время мониторинга Ульмас  за станком.
Кредит хочет потратить на увеличение оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Ulmas Sutonova is a 48 year old woman, she is married and has three children. She lives in the Utkansoi area, in the Kizilblok village. Together with her husband she raises and sells large and small (e.g. goats) livestock. Ulmas herself spends most of her time making yarn and selling it at the market. During the loan monitoring, Ulmas was at her loom. She would like to use her loan in order to increase the working capital for her livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 26 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife. Hussein has owned a barber shop for six years. He is requesting a loan of 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat, an air conditioning unit and a washing machine. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan. Hussein is special in his field of work because he is highly skilled and is aware of innovative styles and techniques. His clients are people from his local community. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Hussein decided to start his business because of his experience in the field. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 43 years old and married with a child. He makes lady’s hair nets of various shapes and sizes. The demand for his hair nets is high. He hopes for the loan to purchase more materials like wool, thread, etc to make more hair nets to sell. He hopes to expand this business and thanks all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make ladies hair net

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 37 year old man who lives in Lebanon with his wife and two children. Mouahamad owns a marble factory and is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase merchandise for his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.  He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elis is a 28 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his parents. Elie has owned a computer shop for three years. He also installs Internet connections. Elie has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majomoua in order to purchase a new computer. This is the first time that Elie has requested a loan. 
Elie is special in his work because he is the only one in his region. His clients are people from his region. In the future, Elie plans on expanding his business by opening a coffee Internet shop.

loans.use: Elie will use the loan to purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is 25 years old, and lives with his parents in Bit Jbeil, located in Southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a panel writer for five years. He is requesting a loan of $2000 to purchase a set of writing instruments and tools, to facilitate and increase the flow of his business. Mouhamad hopes that his loan will help increase his business and provide him with enough income to expand his clientele and outreach.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and instruments

loans.name: Francees

texts.en: Francees is a single 29 year old. She sells rechargeable phone cards and wishes to expand her business. Francees hopes to receive a loan so that she can purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She sends thanks to all kiva lenders. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en: Adeola is 43 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs like rice, tomato paste, palm oil, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a hard-working woman. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
