Санчаров Улугбек мужчина 30 лет , женат имеет троих детей. Жена не работает занимается уходом за детьми. Сам Улугбек работает в колхозе на поле , его работа заключается полив полей. Кроме этого он занимается бизнесом животноводства.
На данный момент у него оборотный капитал очень большой, 30 коз и все они с козлятами.Во время мониторинга Улугбек как раз кормил коз.На  деньги кредита Улукбек хочет купать ещё пару десятков коз.Его жена занимается производством козьей пряжи.
texts.en:
Ulugbek S. is a 30 year old man, he is married and has three children. His wife does not work and takes care of the children. Ulugbek works at a collective farm in the fields, he waters the fields. In addition, he raises livestock. He currently has a lot of capital in circulation – he has 30 goats and all of them have baby goats. During loan monitoring, Ulugbek was feeding his goats. Ulugbek would like to use his loan to purchase 20 more goats. His wife weaves goat yarn.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 goats

loans.name: Rona Fe

texts.en:
Rona Fe P. is a 23-year-old mother of two. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital for a variety store. She applied for this loan to buy assorted soft drinks, candies, bread, canned foods, and others to sustain her business. 

Rona Fe is glad to have this venture, for she earns income she saved for her weekly payment and it supports the needs of her family. She hopes to expand her store in the future in order to keep her regular customers. She dreams of saving more money to be able to send her children to school and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for variety store

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She has a store where she sells medicines and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs to her customers within her community in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Louïse

texts.fr:
B. Louïse est âgée de 41 ans. Louïse est originaire d'Adjohoun, un village du département de l'OUEME dans le sud BENIN. Louïse est mariée à HOUEZEHOUDE François, un forgeron de profession. Louïse est mère d'une fille de trois (3) ans qui est à la maternelle. Louïse vit avec sa famille à Agbato, un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Louïse vendait depuis 1988 de maïs en gros et en détails. Mais Louïse a abandonné depuis sept (7) ans cette activité au profit de la vente à crédit des bols, bassines en série, chaussures et autres produits. En effet, Louïse collecte les besoins de ses clients en ces produits et va les acheter à Lomé Capitale du TOGO, pays frontalier du Bénin. A son retour de Lomé, Louïse distribue à chaque client sa commande à crédit. C'est après quelques jours selon la date fixée par l'acheteur que Louïse repasse collecter ses fonds auprès de ses clients. Louïse n'arrive plus à satisfaire bien la demande de sa clientèle parce que sa clientèle a augmenté et que ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent plus d'acheter toute la commande de ses clients. Louïse sollicite alors un quatrième crédit pour couvrir toute la demande de ses clients.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Louïse B., 41, comes from Adjohoun, a village in the province of Oueme in the south of Benin. Louise is marrïed to François Houezehoude, a professional blacksmith, and is the mother of a 3-year-old daughter who goes to pre-school.

Louïse lives with her family at Agbato, an outlying neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Starting in 1988, Louïse sold maize, wholesale and retail. 7 years ago, she left this business in favor of the sale of bowls, sets of basins, shoes and other items. As it happens, Louïse finds out what her customers need in terms of this sort of product and goes to get the orders in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin.

On her return from Lomé, Louïse distributes each customer's order on credit. Then, several days later, according to what has been agreed on with the customer, Louïse comes back to collect her money. Louïse is never able to satisfy the demand of her clientele completely because it has grown and her financial means don't allow her to buy everything that has been ordered.

Louïse is requesting a fourth loan to cover all the needs of her customers. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bowls, sets of basins, shoes, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ulcha

texts.ru: Ульча женщина в возросте 51 год , замужем ,имеет пятерых детей.Сама Ульча полностью занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё сейчас пять коров, которые дают молоко.Ульча сама мастерица производства домашнего кефира. У неё очень много клиентов.Ульча узнав от соседей, что можно в кредит увеличить скот, она решила обратится в Микроинвест.При мониторинге было выявлено, что все данные соответствуют явному и Ульча имеет положительный моральный облик, который подходит по критериям клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ulcha is 51 years old, married and has five children. She is involved solely in raising and selling livestock. She now has five dairy cows that supply milk. Ulcha is an expert at cooking home-made kefir. She has many customers. Having learnt from neighbors that she can obtain a loan in order to increase her livestock headcount, Ulcha reached out to MicroInvest. Business monitoring showed all given facts to be true, and Ulcha has a positive image, suitable to MicroInvest client criteria.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
A. Islomjon is married and the father of three children. Islomjon received education up to secondary school level, but he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to continue. Now he works as a farmer.

Islomjon has a good work ethic and he has wholeheartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has become a man known for his determination and he serves as an example to other farmers. He has been growing wheat, corn, onions and tomatos for the past 4 years.

Islomjon is now seeking a loan of 2400 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops in the hopes of making prepayments for the upcoming season and to ensure a good harvest. In so doing, he can better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jhonalyn

texts.en:
Jhonalyn O. is a 29-year-old mother of two. They live in a beautiful village along the sea. Her husband is a fisherman. Jhonalyn is the one selling the catch of her husband; she sells the fish in the nearby villages, carrying it on foot. With some of her loan, she plans to buy a bicycle to avoid walking miles just to sell all her fish. She hopes that in the future, she can get a stall in the market to increase her income. 
 
Jhonalyn wants to save more money to build a better house while her children are young, and save some for the education of her children. Her membership in ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) is one way of having new friends and customers.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fish and to purchase a bicycle for fish vending

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
B. Murodjon is 30 years old. He is married with three children. He lives in Isfara town with his parents. Despite his young age, Murodjon works hard in order to provide his family with necessary food and education. He has a business selling cement at the building materials market. He has been in this business for 2 years and gained a rich experience. He has a special warehouse where he keeps his goods in safety. He knows how to protect cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate.

All this allows Murodjon to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family. Currently he needs to restock his goods as the number of his clients is increasing day by day. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Murodjon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cement in order to increase his inventory

loans.name: Luy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group that is made up of four people, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Luy T., 40, has been selected to be leader by the members. T. and her husband make a living selling fresh fish in the market. They normally earn an income of US$ 4 each day to feed the family. The couple has given birth to one young child who is enrolled in the local school.

T. now has many regular customers buying her fish, so her business is running very well with much income. To make the business more successful and to earn extra income, T. is looking for a loan in order to increase her capital, by buying more fish to sell.

The other three borrowers are:

S., 54, who sells fruit in the market and requests a loan to increase the quantity of fruit she has for sale;

Y., 44, a local fruit seller, who is asking for a loan to repair his old house; he was not available for photographing, so his wife is shown in the picture instead;

S., 26, who sells a little fruit out of her home and is applying for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.en:
M. Gairatjon has a responsibility that makes him work hard for improvement. He is a farmer. He grows onions and potatoes, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and providing what is necessary for his family that needs it.

For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Gairatjon knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Gairatjon makes is to purchase fertilizer necessary for his land. Support this hard-working man so his effort is worthwhile.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sabitiou

texts.fr:
T. Sabitiou est née le 14/06/1974 à TAKON, un village du département du PLATEAU dont elle est originaire. Sabitiou est mariée à AGBANGLA Djamiou et est mère de deux (2) enfants: l'aîné s'appelle Latifatou; il a quinze (15) ans et est en quatrième année du lycée. Le second enfant s'appelle Jalale, il a neuf (9) ans; Jalale est en cinquième année du cours primaire. Les besoins de la famille de Sabitiou sont assurés par son mari. Sabitiou et sa famille vit à Agbodjèdo, un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Sabitiou est arrivée à Cotonou à l'âge de quinze (15) ans après avoir abandonné l'école. Dès son arrivée Sabitiou s'est lancée dans la vente de pomme de terre de façon ambulante. C'est-à-dire que pour ses ventes Sabitiou passe de maison en maison avec le plateau de pomme de terre à la tête. Mais depuis trois ans, aidée par son mari et ses parents, Sabitiou a diversifié  son commerce: Aujourd'hui Sabitiou vend en plus des légumes, des fruits, des boissons, des savons liquides etc. Sabitiou vend dans le centre ville de Cotonou. La majorité de sa clientèle est faite d'étrangers résidents au Bénin (les Libanais, les Français, les Américains, etc). La demande de la clientèle de Sabitiou est devenue très importante. Pour la satisfaire, Sabitiou a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sabitiou T. was born on June 14, 1974 in Takon, a village in the Plateau province, where her roots lie. She is married to Djamiou Agbangla and is the mother of two children: the elder is named Latifatou. He is 15 and in the fourth year at the lycée. Her second child is called Jalale; he is 9 and is in the 5th grade in primary school.

The needs of Sabitiou's family are covered by her husband. Sabitiou and her family live in Agbodjèdo, an outlying neighborhood near Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Sabitiou came to Cotonou at the age of 15, after having left off schooling. As soon as she arrived, Sabitiou began to sell potatoes, door-to-door, that is to say, she would go from house to house with a tray of potatoes on her head.

After three years, aided by her husband and her parents, Sabitiou diversified her business. Today, she sells vegetables, fruit, drinks, liquid soaps, etc. Sabitiou sells in the center of the city of Cotonou. Most of her clientele is made up of foreigners living in Bénin (Lebanese, French, Americans, etc.) The demand of her clientele has become quite big and to satisfy it, Sabitiou needs more working capital than she presently has.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, fruit, drinks in cans and bottles, mineral water, liquid soap, etc.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat P. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His elder daughter is a student in the National Medical School in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and his younger daughter is a local high school student. 

Erdenebat and his wife have been running a small business retailing meat since 2005. Erdenebat visits herders in the countryside and purchases livestock at a discount whenever he can. Once he brings the livestock home, he slaughters and butchers the meat into small pieces for individual sale. When it has been prepared for market, his wife sells the meat in the local food retail market. 

In the future, he would like to open a large butcher shop. He hopes to be able to afford his daughters' college tuition. He requests a loan to purchase more livestock from herders in the countryside.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock from herders

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
O. Baroat is the humble mother of a family with two children and she works hard to educate them. She works in agriculture, along with her husband of 3 years, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at growing corn and wheat, which they sell in the market. Last season was very good, and after much effort, they took in a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the results of their labor. 

Currently Baroat’s family has a financial problem and she needs help from of all of us. The family’s desire is to continue planting corn and wheat and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seed and fertilizer. For this purpose, Baroat and her family are requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nomindalai

texts.en:
Nomindalai H. lives with her husband and two children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is a student in the University of Arts and Culture in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her son is a high school student. 
Nomindalai runs a clothing stall in the local market and sells secondhand clothes imported from China. Her husband is a taxi driver and also helps with her business whenever he has the time. She started the clothing business in 2003. It has been quite successful. She frequently goes to Ereen, China - a border town where many goods are purchased for importation to Mongolia. There she buys cheap secondhand clothes for her retail business. 
Nomindalai's dream is to see her daughter perform on TV, as she is so talented and is doing so well in her studies. The University of Arts and Culture has produced many well-known Mongolian artists. Although university tuition is expensive, this mother hopes to do well in her business so she can continue to support her daughter's education. She requests a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes from China

loans.name: Jamolbek

texts.en:
S. Jamolbek is 30 years old and is married with two children. He is a farmer and grows wheat, corn, and tomatoes, something he has done for 5 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Jamolbek, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. Jamolbek also raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. 

Now Jamolbek wants to borrow money to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops. This is Jamolbek's first loan from IMON International and he promises to repay the loan without any violations as he has done with previous loans.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Oibek

texts.en:
S. Oibek works in agriculture. He has been farming for the past 5 years and learned all the secrets and experiences of farming from his father. At certain times Oibek must leave his home to head for his distant farmlands to fertilize and care for them. He does all this hard work for the good of his family. 

Oibek is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, with the goal that he will have quality and profitable products in the coming harvest. Oibek hopes that you can meet his request for the good of his agricultural production.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is a 42 year-old-mother of seven. Her husband drives a motorcycle for hire. Josephine joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) five years ago. Her membership impacted her, especially her attitude. Before, she would indulge in playing cards (gambling) and not bother about her family's future. When she joined ASHI she learned how to do business and she organized her duties as a mother. She made many improvements to make her business grow. 

Josephine applied for this loan to buy seven sacks of rice, ten sacks of charcoal, soft drinks, and curls. She wants to save more money to expand her variety store. She dreams of sending her seven children to college so they each can land a job.

loans.use: To buy assorted food for variety store.

loans.name: Khidir

texts.en:
T. Khidir was born in 1961 and is married with 4 children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. For the past 15 years Khidir has grown wheat and corn on his land. His sons help him with the business. 

Khidir wants his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. Thanks to his effort and diligence now his elder daughter is studying at the University. 

Currently Khidir requests 2500 Somoni in order to buy wheat and corn seeds and mineral fertilizer. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri S. lives with his wife in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. They have three grown children. The youngest two are still in college. Batsuuri carries drinking water from a well that is outside his town for sale around town. He has two horses and an old horsecart that he uses for carrying water. He started his business in 2004 and supports his family with his profits. 

Now he brings water into town once every two days, but he would like to carry and sell water every day, as the demand for drinking water is increasing. Today he has some trusted locals who always buy drinking water from him. He hopes to one day build a well close to his home and own the drinking water supply business in the town. He requests a loan to purchase extra horse feed for his plan to increase his trips to the well.

loans.use: To purchase extra horse feed.

loans.name: Dada

texts.en:
U. Dada is a very hard-working and enterprising man who works long hours cultivating his farmland. It is to this farm that he owes his daily bread, so he tries to take care of it as best he can. Dada is one of the most dedicated farmers we have ever known, and every morning the people of his town see him walking to his work. He is one of the most respected people in the area and is known for the example he sets for his children and the rest of the town. The courage and devotion he puts into his job as a farmer is what stands out in this man. Nonetheless, he has difficulties and financial problems that are bringing him irregularities and losses. For this reason Dada is requesting your help with a loan to increase his production by buying additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr:
A. Judith est née le 10 juin 1975 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du Bénin. Judith est originaire de DANGBO un village du département de l'OUEME dans le sud BENIN. Judith a divorcé de son mari depuis huit (8) ans et elle n'a pas d'enfant. Judith vit en location à kowegbo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Judith vend des tissus bazin riche. Judith est couturière de formation. Judith a laissé la couture parce que ça ne marchait plus bien pour elle. Judith a commencé la vente de tissus depuis onze (11) ans. Judith a une clientèle importante et elle pense diversifier son activité. Judith veut vendre en plus de tissus, des bijoux et colliers. C'est dans cette optique que Judith sollicite un crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Judith was born on June 10, 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. She traces her roots to DANGBO, a village of OUEME county in southern Benin. She has been divorced for eight years and has no children. Judith rents a place in Kowegbo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells rich damask fabrics. She is a seamstress by training, though she left this trade because it was no longer doing well for her. She started selling fabrics eleven years ago and has a sizable number of customers. She's thinking of diversifying her business. She wants to sell more fabrics, some jewelry, and necklaces. With this in mind, Judith is requesting a loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics (rich damask)

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.en:
Y. Aminjon is 24 years old, married and has two children. Aminjon's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business by offering better service to his customers. His dream is that God will provide him with a long life so that he can get ahead and fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Khujand, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for six years. Currently Aminjon’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow $600 for 12 months. He thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is the mother of eight whose husband is a carpenter. She has been a member of ASHI, a Kiva field partner, since 2000. ASHI helped her start a business raising cattle, and she also raises pigs.

Fely plans to use the proceeds of the loan she is applying for to buy two new cows and two pigs, along with feed and supplements for her animals. In the future, she would like to expand her hog-raising business even more. If she has enough income, Fely would like to make improvements to her house so she and her family can live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy two cattle and two pigs

loans.name: Erhembaatar

texts.en:
Erhembaatar T. lives with his wife and a daughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a student at a local secondary school. Erhembaatar runs a small retail stall in the local market where he sells toys and children's clothes. His wife works with him as a saleswoman. He launched this business in 2001 by selling toys and clothes he imported from Ereen, China, a border town where many Chinese goods enter Mongolia. 

Whenever he goes to Ereen and brings cheap products for resale, his wife works alone a saleswoman. Since its inception, the business has done well. His capital has doubled, and he is applying for a loan to buy more children's  products to sell. Erhembaatar hopes to be able to buy a car with his new profits because a car would help him run the business much more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.en:
K. Foziljon is a very hard-working man who lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is disabled and not able to find work at a traditional company. After having been rejected for various jobs, he decided to start his own business providing welding services four years ago. He started this business in his home, and the good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients. Now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs. Foziljon’s desire is to keep growing as a businessman, and in order to do this he is asking for a loan of $800 to refurbish his shop and buy some equipment so that he can improve service. He will repay this amount over 10 months. Your help will be very useful to Foziljon and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To buy equipment he needs to improve service.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora N. is 27 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Nigora been raising cattle for three years. She tries to invest as much time as possible in her animals. She tries to bathe and vaccinate her animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe the rams and it's not easy to reach. But without a doubt, the results please her: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a big source of satisfaction. Now Nigora plans to invest the money that she is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of her animals. She will then generate more income, and with it, improve her family’s quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
Kodirjon S. is a hardworking and determined man. As a child he was an excellent student, but upon finishing his studies he was unable to find any work due to the severe economic problems in his country. Instead, Kodirjon decided to invest his small savings to start his own business whereby he sells rice at the market. Over time he has expanded his business to the point that the business is now the sole source of income for his family, which consists of his wife and three children. He explains that there is high demand for his rice because of its excellent quality, size, and flavor. As a result, Kodirjon is applying for a loan in the amount of $800 in order to buy more goods for resale purposes. In turn, he expects to generate more income, which will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional rice

loans.name: Оrif

texts.ru:
Ориф мужчина в возросте 38 лет ,женат имеет шестерых детей.Жена на дому занимается продажей пряжи.Сам Ориф работает в Горно обогатительном комбинате г.Адрасмана.Раньше он работал пастухом в колхозе.Но т.к.
ему не платили за работу ,он устроился на работу в комбинат.Кроме своей работы он имеет бизнес откорма и продажи скота.У него сейчас 10 коз и 15 баранов.Ориф решил увеличить свой бизнес в сезон , когда скот дешёвый на рынке, для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Orif is 38 years old, married and has six children. His wife sells yarn at home. Orif works at a mining and concentration plant in the city of Adrasman. Previously, he worked as a shepherd at an agricultural collective; however, because he was not receiving pay from the collective, he went to work for the plant. Besides this work, Orif also has a business of raising and selling livestock. He currently owns 10 goats and 15 sheep. Orif decided to expand his business now, during the season when livestock market price is low. This is why he reached out to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Sadjida

texts.en:
Sadjida E. is a married woman with three children. With the knowledge she acquired from her parents and grandparents, she has been successful in raising cattle in a special space in her home. Sadjida's work in animal sales generates a nice amount of income for her family. Currently she has four cows in her house, but she would like to increase the variety of her animals over time, which is why she is now seeking a loan in the amount of $700. Sadjida’s dream is to see her children complete their studies.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of five children.  She has two daughters who have graduated from college, two children who are still in college, and another child that is no longer in school.  Before she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) she sold various snack foods.  The proceeds from previous loans she received were used to open up her store.  

She is now applying for another loan to buy assorted groceries, which she believes will help her both sustain and expand her business.  Indeed, she wants to expand her store in the future in order to generate additional income so that she can finance her two college students' studies.  She feels that, by expanding her inventory, she will maintain her loyal customers and attract new customers.  Finally, she explains that her membership in ASHI has had a positive impact on her life and her entire family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional foods

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Мавзуна женщина ,которая занимается продажей женских сумок.она сама ездит за товаром в Турцию.Она замужем , имеет одного сына.Муж работает в молочном комбинате, разводит молочные продукты по магазинам.
Мавзуна хочет в кредит увеличить ассортимент сумок.Сейчас пора весны, все женщина обновляют свой гардероб, а также и сумки.На первый раз она решила подать на маленькую сумму, но в дальнейшем планирует продолжать сотрудничать с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is involved in the business of selling women’s purses. She travels to Turkey for the goods. She is married and has one son. Her husband works at a milk processing plant and delivers dairy products to stores. Mavzuna wants to increase her purse assortment. Now during the spring, women tend to update their clothing and purses. Mavzuna decided to obtain a small-sum loan right now, but plans to continue working with MicroInvest in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of women's purses

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
E. Antoinette est âgée de 28 ans; elle est née à Allada et est originaire de AZOVE un petit village du département du MONO. Antoinette est mariée à SOTON Mathieu; elle n'a pas d'enfant et personne n'est à sa charge. Antoinette vend depuis trois ans des chaussures dans le marché international du BENIN. Antoinette achète ses chaussures en gros à Tokpa, marché international du BENIN et les revend en détail dans le même marché. Antoinette envisage aller elle-même à Lomé, Capitale du TOGO un pays frontalier du Bénin pour acheter ses chaussures afin de réaliser plus de profit. C'est dans cette optique que Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
E. Antoinette, age 28, was born in Allada and traces her roots to AZOVE, a small village in MONO county. She is married to SOTON Mathieu and has no children or anyone to support. For three years, she has been selling shoes in Tokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She buys shoes wholesale there in Tokpa and resells them retail in the same marketplace. Antoinette envisions going herself to Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, to buy shoes in order to realize more profit. With this in mind, she's requesting a third loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 dozen shoes

loans.name: Savru

texts.en:
B. Savru is 36 years old and married. She uses all the money she makes to care for her 2 children and provide for their education. Savru has 10 years experience preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very good use of her capital by adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is a polite and considerate vendor and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her.

Savru's business is doing so well, her net worth is increasing every month. Savru is now requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni with a term of 10 months. She is going to purchase dried apricots and process them to extend the range of her goods.

Savru expresses her gratitude to everyone who is supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат женщина 39 лет, замужем,имеет двоих детей.Саломат с 2006 года кредитуется в Микроинвест.Она по сезонно меняет ассортимент своих товаров. На сегодня у неё ассортимент составляет помидоры и огурцы.Для увеличения оборотного капитала Саломат подала следующую заявку на займ.Она в числе хороших клиентов.
texts.en:
Saloman is a woman of 39 years, married and has two children. Salomat has been a client at MicroInvest since 2006. She is changing the assortment of her merchandise every season. At this time her assortment includes tomatoes and cucumbers. To increase her working capital Salomat has applied for her next loan. She is among our good clients.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf N. is 30 years old. He lives in the town of Isfara. He is married and has a son. Maruf processes and sells dried fruits in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of dried fruits. He purchases dried fruits from local farmers at wholesale prices and after processing sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Maruf to make his business quite successful, and it brings in a stable income for his family. Currently, he needs a loan of $800 USD to buy supplies so he can continue to offer quality products to his customers. Maruf expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.    

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Glwadys

texts.fr:
K. Glwadys est née le 13 Avril 1980. Glwadys est originaire de KESSOUNOU dans le département de l'OUEME. Glwadys est mariée à DANDJINOU Olivier et est mère de deux jumeaux: Junior et Jéovani, âgés de sept (7) ans et tous en deuxième année du cours primaire. Glwadys et sa famille réside à Agbodjèdo, un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Glwadys a commencé la vente de divers (bombons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) devant son domicile après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire. Actuellement, Glwadys vend des légumes et des fruits à GANHI, un marché situé au centre ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. L'activité de Glwadys est très florissante. Pour renforcer son capital en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Glwadys sollicite un crédit. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Glwadys was born on April 13, 1980 and traces her roots to KESSOUNOU, in OUEME county. She is married to DANDJINOU Olivier and is the mother of twins: Junior and Jéovani, seven years of age and both in their second year of primary school. Glwadys and her family reside in Agbodjèdo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou. She started selling various goods (candy, cookies, canned milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, laundry soap, dish soap, bath soap, etc.) in front of her home after she failed to earn her diploma. Currently, she sells vegetables and fruit at GANHI, a marketplace located in downtown Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Her business is booming. To bolster her capital for responding better to the demands of her customers, Glwadys is requesting a loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Djalil

texts.en:
R. Djalil is married and has two children who he is very proud of, since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children will go to college someday, he started a business 4 years ago, processing and selling dried apricot in order to make enough money to pay for their schooling. He is experienced in this kind of business, which allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now, Djalil is requesting $800 USD for purchasing more dried apricot to process and to sell. With your help, Djalil will be able to feel proud that, through much effort, his children can go to college and become educated people.

Tajikistan Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. loans.use: To buy dried apricot in order to expand his business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has worked in agriculture for more than 5 years. She is a very hardworking housewife. She has 5 hectares of land and works it by seeding, weeding, and irrigating her plot in order to prevent the vegetables from drying. This year she has decided to increase the quantity of her produce because she will be helped by her son. Besides her work in agriculture, Elena has a job as a teacher of Romanian language at a school in the village. Elena is borrowing a loan from Microinvest to purchase seeds, as her teacher's salary is not enough to pay all her expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds to increase her produce yield

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty J. is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes and cabbages and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Betty is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk in the United Nations office, and she has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Tukhtasun

texts.en:
S. Tukhtasun is 59 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. Tukhtasun is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Tukhtasun is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land, and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields.

Tukhtasun needs seeds and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 2000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Tukhtasun.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer and fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia C. is a 55-year-old mother of eleven. Her husband Orlando is a fisherman. They live in the beautiful town of Pandan, Antique, on the island of Panay. The main product of the municipality is objects made of the "pandan" (pandanus) tree. The famous products they sell are woven bags, mats, hats, pencil cases and others.

Celedonia learned weaving from her parents during her childhood. She applied for this loan to buy the needed raw materials. She hopes to purchase materials in bulk to get a lower price in the market. She will spend some of her loan to buy "palay" (rice). She hopes to improve her products in the future by joining some seminars or workshops ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) will provide for members' product development.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving ( mats) and to buy rice (palay)

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer M. is 32 years old and lives in the beautiful coastal town of Pandan, located in northern Antique Province. She has two daughters and one son, aged 6, 4, and 2 respectively. She is unmarried, but lives with her partner Jojit; he is a laborer.

Jennifer is a business-minded person who runs a sari-sari store, raises chickens, and grows and sells vegetables. "Sari-sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and the shops sell just that: an assortment of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. Jennifer plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her sari-sari store, and to buy chickens to raise.

Jennifer hopes to be able to further develop herself in dealing with others, grow her business, and wishes a bright future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase food, beverages and other inventory for a small variety store, and to buy baby chickens to raise

loans.name: Bottul

texts.en:
Bottul Z. currently sells beans, cooking oil, mangoes, etc. and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Bottul is 41 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. sells tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Grace is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has 4 children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин  1966 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Окончил 10 классов, высшего образования не имеет. Дома разводит скот. Семья помогает ухаживать за скотом. В свободное время сажает в огороде зелень и овощи. От этого урожая есть и доход. С наступлением весны скот отправляют в горы на пастбище.  Увеличив вес скот возвращается откормленным и готовый для продажи. Остаются те, которые идут на продажу и которые должны скоро родить. Кредит получает в первые, планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Shamsidin was born in 1966, he is married and has five children. He has completed 10 grades of schooling and does not have higher education. He is raising cattle at home. His family helps him to keep after the cattle. In his spare time he sows vegetables and greens in the garden. He receives income form the harvest. With the arrival of spring the cattle is sent to the pastures in the mountains. After gaining weight the cattle returns well fed and ready to be sold. Those ones that are not ready or pregnant will stay. Shamsidin is applying for a loan for the first time and plans to increase the head count of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander runs a small business selling electronics in a bus station market of Mukachevo, Transcarpathians. The location of his business is very favorable as there are many bus and car drivers who come for electronic supplies and parts for their vehicles. Alexander offers assorted merchandise which attracts new customers and brings many of them back later. Alexander has been in this trade for 4 years. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnas in working capital.

The inventory Alexander offers for retail sale is always in high demand. Alexander enjoys working with this type of merchandise. He likes electronics and can always give good advice to a customer. This time he is seeking a loan for 10,000 Grivnas. He is hoping to increase his turnover capital and sales as a result. Alexander is planning to grow his business and keep stable standing ensuring his decent livelihood.

loans.use: To generate additional income by expanding inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace I. is currently in the business of selling maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more flour and other food items to sell. Grace is 52 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children, and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more four and other food items to sell

loans.name: Vitalie

texts.en:
Vitalie has been working in the retail food market for more than 5 years. He buys merchandise from a wholesaler at much lower prices compared with the prices on the retail market. He sells only foodstuffs and soft drinks. His business has been successful since people buy food every day.

Vitalie wants to increase his stock and rent a small grocery store to sell his products. He is requesting a loan from Microinvest to increase his working capital. This will be a great opportunity to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy goods and pay rent for a grocery store

loans.name: Adesina

texts.en: Adesina T. is 26 years old and single. He sells second-hand computers to his customers. He is requesting for the loan amount of NGN100,000 ($700) to purchase more second-hand computers to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand computers to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. currently sells carbbages, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, etc and is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes and groundnuts to sell. Mary is 45 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 6 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia sells clothing in the central marketplace of Beregovo. She offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. Sylvia ventured to launch her own small business about 8 years ago. Currently, she has 18,000 Grivnas ($2,375 US) in working capital. Net profit amounts to 2,000-2,300 Grivnas a month. 

Sylvia is seeking a 1,700 Grivna ($225 US) loan to add to her stock and meet the growing demand. She has already repaid several loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. We believe her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.  

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 6 weeks.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Jadesimi

texts.en: Jadesimi O. is 55 years old and married with 7 children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. Jadesimi says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey lives and works in Beregovo. He owns a small lingerie business called "Image" in one of the local markets. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise which is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Andrey stay afloat with his business for five years. In fact, he has not only managed to keep his business sustainable and profitable, but has also increased his working capital up to 12,000 Hryvnia. His net profit is 2,500 Hryvnia a month. 

Andrey decided to go into this line of business because competition is lacking. He feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Andrey is a focused entrepreneur looking for growth and further expansion of his venture. He believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of his business. He is requesting a loan of 1,700 Hryvnia to increase his working capital. 

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid very quickly.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is 43 years old and married with three children.  All her children are in school.  Omolara sells drinks, retail, to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther Idowu is 53 years old and married with seven children.  She sells planks.  Esther is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 39 years old and married with no child.  She sells foodstuffs, wholesale and retail to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  Grace says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake A. is 40 years old and married with three children.  She sells bags, shoes and jewelries.  Folake is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shoes, bags and jewelry to sell.  Folake says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more shoe, bags and jewelries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 53 years old and married with four children.  She sells medicine and provisions.  Margaret is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and medicine to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more medicine and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe J. is 56 years old and married with six children.  She sells foodstuffs and provisions.  Modupe is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget T. is 37 years old and married with three children.  She sells medicines to her retail customers.  Bridget is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell.  Bridget says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Oluwafemi Olalekan

texts.en: Oluwafemi Olalekan A. has a shop at the front of his house where he barbs hair for his customers.  He is requesting a loan of N80,000  to purchase more barbing materials, like hair clippers.  He is 28 years old and married with a child.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more barbing materials.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. is 54 years old and married with three children.  She sells foodstuffs and provisions.  Celestina is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Adetokunbo

texts.en: Adetokunbo F. is 29 years old and married without a child.  She sells sarongs.  Adetokunbo is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She hopes to expand her business. Adetokunbo says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is 42 years old. She is married and has five children; three of whom have completed senior high school. The others are in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Akua is a food vendor. She sells Kenkey. She prepares it in-house and sells in the local market square. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared with maize (corn dough). She procures the raw materials – maize, fish, vegetables, etc. from the local market.

Akua has been in the Kenkey selling business for seven years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk.

loans.use: Procure raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is 40 years old. She is a divorced mother with three children. She says it is not easy being a single mother. Her children are still in school; senior high and junior high school. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Janet is a trader and food vendor. She sells kenkey and trades in other food stuffs such as plantains and potatoes. She prepares kenkey in-house and sells by the road side in the evenings. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). Janet procures the raw materials – maize, fish, vegetables, etc. from the local market. She says that sometimes she travels to nearby towns to buy at better prices.

Janet has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Lamidi

texts.en: Lamidi is 40 years old and married with three children.  He sells motor tires and rims.  Lamidi is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor tires and rims to sell.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more motor tires and rims to sell.

loans.name: Hasie

texts.en:
Hasie M. is 32 years old. She is married with two children. One is currently in basic school and the other has yet to start school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Hasie works to support her husband financially. She is a trader of cosmetics. Hasie procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc. and hawks to sell in the community where she lives. Hasie also treks to other markets to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure varieties of cosmetics in bulk. She is hopeful to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: Procure cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B. is 46 years old.  She is married with five children, all of whom have completed senior high school.  Some are working while others are learning trades.  She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Afua sells vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. on a table top in the market square.  She procures the vegetables from farmers in the nearby small communities at effective prices.  She says she supplies the greater percentage of vegetables to food vendors and other retailers.  Afua has been in this business for 27 years and is endowed with rich experiences.  She wants a loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: Procure vegetables.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba M. is 54 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children. She says it is not easy for her at all providing for the family as a single mother of three children. One of them is currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Habiba is a food vendor. She sells kenkey. She prepares the kenkey in the house she lives in and sells by the roadside in the evenings. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). She procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and other vegetables from the local market. Habiba has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the support they need.

loans.use: To procure raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is 40 years old. She is a married mother of four children. She says it is necessary to work to support her husband financially. Two of her children are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Akua is a food vendor. She sells rice with stew. She says she prepares the food in the house she lives in and sells in a school compound during school hours. She procures bags of rice and other food ingredients from the local market. Akua has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the support they need in school.

loans.use: To procure ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.en:
