Vilma Esperanza is married with three children, the eldest of whom is currently enrolled in school. Her business is selling bicycle parts and she has a person who works with her to help make sales. Vilma also sells cell phones and phone cards and in her spare time when she is in her house, she raises pigs. Her husband works full time selling building materials and his income helps to support her and their children. Vilma is requesting this loan to better stock her business with more bicycle parts. She would also like to buy more pigs. Vilma’s dreams are to one day have another business and that her children have an opportunity to continue studying.

*******************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*******************************************

Vilma Esperanza, es casada tiene tres hijos y la mas grande esta estudiando. Ella se dedica a vender repuestos de bicicletas y tiene una persona quien le ayuda a vender, también vende teléfonos celulares y tarjetas, y en sus tiempos libres que esta en su casa tiene una crianza de marranos, su esposo trabaja en una venta de materiales de construcción para ayudarla a ella y a sus hijos, su credito lo necesita para seguir surtiendo  su negocio y para comprar mas marranos, sus sueños son tener otro negocio y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike C. O. is 45 years old and married with three children. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. 

He produces and sells palm oil in wholesale and retail. He needs the loan amount of US$1,025 (N150,000) to purchase more palm nuts for the production of palm oil to sell. The demands for his palm oil are high, and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. 

He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm nuts for the production of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
K. Aminatou est née le 11 Octobre 1957 à SAKETE un village du département du PLATEAU au sud-est BENIN. Aminatou est originaire de SAKETE, elle est mariée et a quatre (4) enfants: deux (2)filles et deux (2) garçons, tous majeurs et scolarisés. Aminatou vit avec sa famille à AGONGBOMEY, un quartier très peuplé de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Aminatou faisait le commerce de bijoux dans le grand marché international du BENIN. Mais Aminatou a laissé par la suite cette activité parce que cette activité nécessite un grand investissement qu'elle n'est pas en mesure d'avoir. Ainsi, Aminatou a ouvert depuis deux (2) ans une petite boutique où elle vend de divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) et des chaussures, au bord d'une voie principale dans son quartier. Aminatou n'a personne à charge. Le projet de Aminatou c'est d'investir dans sa boutique pour l'agrandir et diversifier ses produits. La demande de la clientèle existe et s'accroît de jour en jour. C'est pourquoi Aminatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Aminatou was born on October 11, 1957 in SAKETE, a village in PLATEAU County in southern BENIN, and traces her roots to SAKETE. She is married, and has four children: 2 girls and 2 boys, who are all adults and schooled. Aminatou lives with her family in AGONGBOMEY, a densely-populated district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She used to do commerce in jewelry at the grand international marketplace of BENIN. But she subsequently dropped that business because it required a large investment she isn't in a position to obtain. And so, she opened a small shop two years ago where she sells various goods (candy, cookies, cans of milk, sardines, and tomatoes, sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc.) and shoes. She makes her sales along the main path in her district. Aminatou doesn't have anyone to support. Her project is to invest in her shop to expand it and to diversify her products. Customer demand exists and is growing day by day. That's why she's requesting a third loan from ALIDÉ.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of sugar, canned milk, detergents, candy, cookies, and shoes

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.en:
The “Las Amistosas” (“Friendly Women”) Village Bank is made up of 10 members (two men and eight women) from the town of Urcos, about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cusco. The group is just beginning its first loan cycles. Most of the group members have taken out loans before from other financial institutions, but for four members, this will be their very first loan. 

The clients are involved in a variety of different businesses: baking and selling bread, selling prepared food (like empanadas and stuffed, fried potatoes), selling locally grown vegetables in the jungle city of Puerto M., selling chicken, cutting and selling eucalyptus trees, renting out retail space, selling grains and dried foods, selling yerba mate at a bus stop, raising livestock and driving a bus. 

The group’s president, Balvina F., is a member of the local bread sellers’ cooperative, in which there are 62 members, including herself. The cooperative gives internal loans to its members, so Balvina has experience in group loans even though this is her first loan from Asociacion Arariwa. When a member of her cooperative breaks the group’s internal regulations, they are punished by being barred from work for one month. “We’re worse than the law,” she chuckles. Balvina plans to bring this same disciplined approach to Las Amistosas. “We must pay on time, faithfully every month, and be punctual,” she says. “The more punctual we are, the better we work together. We must help one another out.” Balvina also has an innovative plan for the group. She sells bread in Urcos’ Plaza de Armas, and says that on weekends and holidays, there are often many visitors looking for a good meal but little in the way of supply. She has proposed to the group that they take turns selling meals like “cuy” (guinea pig) on the Plaza on these occasions in order to generate reserve savings for the group, in case someone falls ill or can’t make a payment for any reason. 

Balvina plans to use her loan to buy bread flour and animal feed for some cows she has on a small farm she owns. Other group members will use their loans to buy potatoes, rice and oil in bulk; to buy vegetables; to buy chickens; to buy eucalyptus trees; to buy a plot of land; to outfit a restaurant, and to buy animal feed. The “Las Amistosas” group has pledged to repay their Kiva loan on time and in full.

loans.use: Buy bread flour, animal feed, vegetables, oil and rice, chickens, a plot of land, eucalyptus trees and other uses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
H. Christine est née le 12/11/1975 à Cotonou mais elle est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Christine est mariée à VIDJENNANGNI Anasthase un mécanicien auto et elle est mère d'une fille de trois ans qui est à la maternelle. Christine vit chez ses beaux parents à GBENONKPO, un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Christine a abandonné l'école en cinquième année du cours primaire par manque de soutient financier. Après son mariage,  Christine s'est lancée dans la vente des bassines, bols et plats en série. L'activité de Christine est très florissante. Christine achète ses marchandises à Lomé, Capitale du TOGO un pays frontalier du Bénin. Actuellement, Christine n'arrive plus à satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle. En effet, Christine  manque d'argent pour acheter toutes les commandes de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Christine demande un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son capital enfin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Christine was born on November 12, 1975 in Cotonou but traces her roots to Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of BENIN. She is married to VIDJENNANGNI Anasthase, an auto mechanic, and she is the mother of a 3-year-old daughter in pre-school. Christine lives in the home of her in-laws in GBENONKPO, a highly populated district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She dropped out of school in her fifth year of primary school due to a lack of financial support. After her marriage, she got started in selling sets of tubs and basins, bowls, and plates. Her business is booming. She buys merchandise in Lomé, the capital of TOGO, a country bordering Bénin. Right now, Christine is no longer able to satisfy all the demands of her customers. This is why she's asking ALIDÉ for a third loan, so as to bolster her capital in order to satisfy her customers better.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins, bowls, and plates

loans.name: Irena

texts.es:
La señora Irena P. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tacagua, periferia de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Benedicto Rojas y sus cinco hijos.
La señora Irena es tejedora, empleada en una empresa de su zona, y su esposo es mecánico en un taller de servicio automotriz.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra gruesa en su vivienda ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan de un ambiente para sus estudios y hábitat.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irena P. lives in her own home in the Tacagua zone on the outskirts of La Paz city. She lives with her husband Mrs. Benedicto Rojas and their five children. Irena is a seamstress. She works in a business in their zone, and her husband is a mechanic in an automotive repair shop. The loan she seeks is to rough in (build) two rooms in her home as her children are growing and they need a place to study and live. This is the 7th time they are seeking a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed favorably qualifies them and they can access a loan. She has been an IMPRO client since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the rough-in construction of building two rooms for her children on their home

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo L. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pokeni, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Gerardo trabaja como empleado en una institución de servicio de esta ciudad.
El crédito solicitado es para el pago de matricula y material de estudios, ya que el señor Gerardo esta realizando estudios superiores y se encuentra pronto a culminar sus estudios.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo L. lives in his own home in the Pokeni zone on the north side of La Paz city. Gerardo works as an employee in a service institution in this city. The loan is to pay tuition and school materials, as Gerardo is studying at the university and will soon be finishing his studies. This is the first time he is seeking a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualifies him favorably and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and school materials to continue his professional education

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Máxima Collque y su hija.
El señor Máximo trabaja como albañil, en construcciones particulares de esta ciudad y su esposa es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto de venta de su zona.
Su vivienda será beneficiada con el servicio de gas domiciliario, para la que necesita realizar la construcción de una cocina para la instalación de ese servicio.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Son clientes de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Quisp lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the westen side of La Paz city. He lives with wife, Mrs. Máxima Collque, and their daughter. Máximo works as a brick layer, in housing construction in this city, and his wife is a cook, selling meals in a sales stand in their zone. Their home will receive gas service, so he needs to build a kitchen in order to install this service. This is the 5th time that they seek a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualifies them favorable and they can access this loan. They have been IMPRO clients since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen to take advantage of home gas service being installed in their neighborhood

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia vive en la calle “Juan Balsa”  de la zona Villa Dolores en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es separada de su esposo actualmente vive con su pequeño hijo en unas habitaciones en alquiler.
 
Se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, queques y todo tipo de masitas, ya que recién termino un curso de reposteria en un instituto de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de  un horno semi industrial para la mejor calidad en su producción. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Analia lives on “Juan Balsa” street in the Villa Dolores zone in El Alto city. She is separated from her husband and today lives with her young son in some rented rooms. She makes tortes, cakes, and all kinds of baked goods, as she recently finished a pastry course in an institute in the city. The loan will be used to acquire a semi-industrial oven to improve the quality of her production. This is her first loan with Impro, and the completed evaluation qualified her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a semi-industrial oven to make her baked goods

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís  vive en la calle “ 2 ”  de la zona San José de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  su bebe de dos años de edad, Ellos forman una pareja joven actualmente viven en la casa de los  padres de su esposa.
 
Trabaja como ayudante de un taller de carpintería en el día, al llegar a su domicilio se dedica, junto a su esposa, a la costura de mandiles para señoras.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de telas e hilos, para incrementar su producción de mandiles, los cuales tienen buena acogida en el mercado. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
José Luís lives on street “2” in the San José zone of Yunguyo in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two year old baby. They are a young couple, and they live in his wife’s parents’ house. He works as a helper in a carpentry workshop during the day. When he gets home he works with his wife sewing aprons for women. The loan will be used to buy fabric and thread in order to increase the production of their aprons. The aprons are well received in the marketplace. It is his first loan with Impro. He has qualified for the loan through an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread for his business of making aprons

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda vive en el Manzano “O”  de la zona Río Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa minera como portero fuera de la ciudad.
 
Trabaja como comerciante en la venta de comida en un puesto callejero,
ubicado en la misma zona de su domicilio.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de verduras, hortalizas, y otros al por mayor, y así reducir sus costos y poder mejorar su utilidad. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Facunda lives in Manzano “O’ of the Río Seco zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her children. Her husband works as a porter in a mining cooperative outside of the city. She sells food from a street stall located in the same zone as her home. With the loan she will buy wholesale vegetables and other food items to reduce costs and increase profits. It is her first loan with Impro. She has qualified for the loan through an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, rice, noodles, etc. for her food selling business

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja como chofer de taxi en su pueblo.
 
Vive en la comunidad Chahuira Pampa, de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus hijos y esposa  quien le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Severo breeds cattle, whose milk he sells to Planta Industrializadota de Leche (PIL) Andina.

He also works as a taxi driver in his town.

He lives in the community Chahuira Pampa in the province of Omasuyos in the department of La Paz, which is located three hours from the city of La Paz.

He lives with his children and his wife, who works with him in doing the household chores and caring for the livestock.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and increase milk production and, in turn, his income.

This is his second loan with IMPRO and his second with Kiva. The completed evaluation qualifies him to recieve the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow in order to increase his volume of milk production.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
T. Rosine est née à Cotonou et est âgée de 32 ans. Rosine est originaire de Adjohoun un village du département de l'Ouémè dans le Sud Bénin. Orphelin de mère, Rosine a abandonné l’école très tôt. Rosine s’est inscrite dans un atelier d’apprentissage de coiffure à Cotonou. Après cinq (5) ans d’apprentissage en coiffure, Rosine a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure dans la maison de son père où elle exerce la coiffure. Rosine associe à la coiffure, la vente des produits de beauté, des mèches et produits pour cheveux. Rosine est mariée à ZOUNMENOU Gilbert un chauffeur de taxi. Rosine est mère de deux garçons: Junior, âgé de sept (7) ans est en troisième année du cours primaire et Jude, âgé de trois (3) ans est à la maternelle. Rosine vit avec sa famille à Ayélawadjè un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C’est le mari de Rosine qui supporte les charges familiales. Rosine veut diversifier son activité. En effet, Rosine veut se lancer également dans la vente de tissus et chaussures. Parce que ses clients expriment le besoin de ces produits. C’est pour renforcer son capital et aussi acheter les chaussures et tissus que Rosine demande un crédit à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
T. Rosine was born in Cotonou and is 32 years old. She traces her roots to Adjohoun, a village in Ouémè County in southern Bénin. Orphaned by her mother, she dropped out of school early and got registered into an apprenticing workshop for hairdressers in Cotonou. After five years of apprenticeship in hairdressing, she opened her own salon in her father's house. She includes along with hairdressing the sale of beauty products, hair extensions, and hair products.

Rosine is married to ZOUNMENOU Gilbert, a taxi driver. She is the mother of two boys: Junior, age 7, in his third year of primary school; and Jude, age 3, in pre-school. She lives with her family in Ayélawadjè, a highly populated district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Her husband is the one who supports the family.

Rosine wants to diversify her business. Actually, she wants to get started also in selling cloth and shoes because her customers are expressing a need for these goods. Bolstering her capital and also buying shoes and cloth is why she's asking ALIDÉ for a loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, hair and beauty products, fabrics, and shoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche), y SOALPRO nueva empresa de acopio de leche vacuna.


Vive en la comunidad Chahuira Pampa, de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su hija la cual se encuentra en edad escolar. que le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Julia breeds cattle, whose milk she sells to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche) and SOALPRO, which has a new business in stocking cow's milk.

She lives in the community Chahuira Pampa in the province of Omasuyos in the department of La Paz, which is located three hours from the city of La Paz.

She lives with her school age daughter who helps with the household chores and the care of the livestock.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and thus increase milk production and, in turn, her income.

This is her first loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies her to recieve the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow in order to increase her volume of milk production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to a child. According to her, her child is in the basic school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Mary is a trader. She trades to support her husband take care of the family. She trades in yams. She procures yam tubers from the farmers in the nearby farming communities at affordable prices. She distributes mostly to food vendors and retailers in her community. Mary says she also cooks some of the yams and sells them with stew. 

She has been trading for two years and wants a loan to procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin and expand her business.

loans.use: To procure yam tubers

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 

También  trabaja en la confección de chamarras los cuales lo vende a poca escala en la feria de su pueblo.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chahuira Pampa, de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus hijos y esposa  quien le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Estanislao breeds cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

He also sells ready-made jackets on a small scale in the market of his town.

He lives in the community Chahuira Pampa in the province of Omasuyos in the department of La Paz, which is located three hours from the city of La Paz.

He lives with his children and his wife, who works with him to do the household chores and care for the livestock.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and thus increase milk production and, in turn, his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow in order to increase his volume of milk production.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 34 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school at the junior high and the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Ama is a petty trader. She trades in vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc., on a table top in the market square. She procures the vegetables from the wholesalers and sometimes from the farmers in the nearby small communities at low prices. She says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. 

Ama has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in large quantities.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy vive en la calle “ Nicolas Bravo”  de la zona  Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 8 años respectivamente, en su domicilio que heredó de sus padres.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de un minibús de transporte publico, entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Willy lives on "Nicolas Bravo" Street in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto.

He lives with his wife and their three children, who are 11, 9, and 8 years old, in the home he inherited from his parents.

He works as a driver and owner of a public transportation minibus between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts to repair the engine of his vehicle.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the engine of his minibus.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. is 24 years old. He is married with four children. According to him, all of his four children are in the basic school. Isaac lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

He is a carpenter by profession. He owns a shop in the community where he works. He makes furniture such as tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc., for clients who call for his services. He also makes furniture that he places by the roadside for sale. Isaac says he has some apprentices who are in training. 

He wants a loan to acquire more tools, equipment and materials such as wood to work with. He has been in business for nine years and hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To procure more tools and materials

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís  vive, en la calle Los Olivos, junto a su esposa y sus hijos que aun se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia que a base de esfuerzo y ahorros lograron adquirir en una zona periférica de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
 El trabaja como empleado publico en una institución del Estado, su esposa Maria cuenta con dos trabajos de medio tiempo como telefonista y radio operadora, ambos en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para ampliar las habitaciones de su domicilio, que actualmente esta en construcción.
 
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives on Los Olivos street with his wife and school age children in their own little house, which, due to much effort and saving, they were able to buy in the outskirts of the city of El Alto. He works as a public employee in a state institution. His wife Maria has two part-time jobs as a telephone operator and a radio operator, both of them in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to enlarge the rooms of his house that is currently under construction. This is his third loan with Impro and he has qualified by evaluation to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as brick, sand, cement to enlarge rooms in his house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes R. is 52 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children. She says it has not been easy for her providing for the family as a single mother of three children. One of them is currently in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Agnes is a trader and a food vendor as well. She sells kenkey and also trades in maize. She prepares the kenkey in the house she lives in and sells it by the roadside in the evenings. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). 

Agnes procures the raw materials such as maize, fish and other vegetables from the local market. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. She hopes to give her children the needed support she can give them to further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are currently in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mavis is a baker. She bakes and supplies bread to food vendors (mostly beverage sellers). She says she also distributes to retailers in her community. Mavis procures the raw materials such as bags of flour, margarine, sugar, etc., from wholesalers in the nearby towns. 

She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure ingredients in bulk. She hopes to give her children the needed support she can give them to further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr:
Âgée de 30 ans, H. Léonie est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN dans le département de l’Ouémé. Léonie est mariée à GOUDJEMINDJI Moïse, un  pêcheur de profession. le couple vit en location avec leurs 6 enfants dont deux filles et quatre garçons tous scolarisés à GANKPODO un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Léonie vendait du pain les matins et de beignets les soirs à son domicile. Mais depuis quatre (4) ans, Léonie vend du soja et du maïs en gros et en détail à son domicile. Léonie achète ses produits dans les villages du Bénin et les vend aux grossistes du grand marché international du BENIN. Léonie reçoit de plus en plus de demande. C’est pourquoi Léonie sollicite un quatrième crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son capital afin de satisfaire ses clients.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Léonie H., 30, comes from Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin, in Ouémé province. Léonie is married to Moïse Goudjemindji, who works as a fisherman. The couple live in a rented apartment with their 6 children, 2 daughters and 4 sons, all of them enrolled in school, in Gankpodo, a district of the city of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin.

Léonie used to sell bread in the morning and fried dough in the evening, out of her home. However, for four years now, she has been selling soy beans and maize wholesale and retail, out of her home. Léonie buys her products in the villages of Bénin and sells them to wholesalers in the big international market in Bénin. Léonie receives more and more requests for her products. That is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital so as to satisfy her customers' needs.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of soy beans and maize

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene  65 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus hijos, quienes son las personas que la motivaron a crecer cada día como madre, pareja y comerciantemente. Y gracias al esfuerzo que muestra en su trabajo logró adquirir una casa donde están enfocados todos sus sueños por cumplir. Desde que se casó tuvo que buscar la forma de  mantener su hogar, para ello trabajó junto a su esposo en el comercio. Gracias a los años de trabajo, su pareja logró adquirir un auto con el cual trabaja ahora todos los días. Entonces Florinda optó por dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, y desde hace 5 años sale a las calles con sus catálogos en mano para visitar a sus amistades, quienes se han convertido en sus clientes más fieles, dándole la posibilidad de crecer como promotora y consultora de belleza. Sin embargo, los costos de venta tienden a variar en diversas fechas y cuando esto sucede confecciona algunos tejidos o peluches para venderlos en las ferias. Esta labor la mantiene ocupada todo el día, sobre todo porque hay que cobrar por los productos distribuidos; siendo este motivo el que la llevó a tomar la decisión de asociarse con su hija mayor para instalar, en su domicilio, una botica, donde trabajen sin tener que trasladarse a diversos lugares, sino solo velar por la buena atención al cliente. Florinda lleva varios años en MFP, trabajando en grupos, pero éste es su primer crédito individual y espera ser cumplidora con los pagos, de la misma forma que ha sido en su grupo de socias donde trabajan en equipo y de manera organizada. El préstamo de 1000 soles será destinado a la compra de mercadería y vitrinas para su botica, ya que los productos están en espera de ser exhibidos.
texts.en:
Florinda is 65 years old and she shares her life with her husband and children who are the people who motivate her to grow each day as a mother, partner, and businesswoman. Thanks to the effort that she has put into her work, she has been able to buy a house where she can focus on her dreams. Ever since she got married she has had to find a way to maintain her household and for this reason she worked with her husband in sales. Thanks to years of work, her husband was able to buy a car that he uses for work every day. Florinda decided to dedicate herself to the sale of cosmetics and for the past 5 years she has taken to the streets, catalogs in hand, to visit her friends who have become her most loyal clients. This has given her the possibility to grow as salesperson and a beauty consultant. But her costs tends to vary depending on the date and when this happens, she makes knitted objects and stuffed animals to sell at fairs. This work keeps her occupied the entire day, mostly because she has to collect payments for the products she has distributed. For this reason she decided to become a business associate with her oldest daughter to start a drugstore in her house where they can work without having to travel to different locations. They can just focus on providing good customer service. Florinda has been a part of MFP for many years, working in groups, but this is her first individual loan and she hopes to be reliable with her payments, the same way that she had been in her members group where they work as a team in an organized manner. The loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) will be used to purchase merchandise and display cabinets for her store, because her products are waiting to be put on display.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: El carisma y optimismo de GracieL. L. impulsa a seguir creciendo, tanto como madre y como comerciante, pues sus hijos y pareja le motivan a continuar en su planes de vida. A pesar de que por motivo de trabajo, su esposo no está a su lado, trata de volcar todo ese amor en sus  dos hijos. Con gran alegría en su rostro, se ocupa de L. compra y venta de licores, negocio que tuvo sus inicios hace 16 años, desde que su hijo mayor le dio L. idea de viajar a L. ciudad de Ica (famosa por sus vinos y piscos) para comprar al por mayor y traer a L. capital las licores, donde toda L. familia terminan de decorar y prepara el producto para su respectiva venta. Esto realiza cada quince días, pues viaja constantemente para cumplir los pedidos que tiene. Los años de dedicación a esta actividad L. tienen agotada y está pensando L. manera de seguir trabajando pero de una manera más tranquiL., pues los viajes son muy cansados. En el futuro, desea instalar en su domicilio un restaurante, porque una de sus habilidades es L. cocina, sobre todo L. repostería, ya que un estudió al respecto y tiene conocimientos de cómo hacer de esta actividad un negocio rentable. Con gran empeño y responsabilidad GracieL. viene trabajando en MFP, donde junto a su banco comunal logró aprovechar las oportunidades y tuvo L. posibilidad de crecer, además, las socias hacen que el trabajo y las reuniones sean amenas. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir grandes cantidades de botellas de vino para venderlas en las ferias y celebridades de su localidad.
texts.en:
GracieL.’s charisma and optimism have pushed her to continue growing as a mother and salesperson and her children and husband motivate her to continue with her life plans. Despite the fact that, for work reasons, her husband is not by her side, she tries to put all of her love into her two children. With great happiness she works in the buying and selling of liquors, a business that began 16 years ago when her oldest son gave her the idea to travel to the city of Ica (famous for its wines and piscos) to buy liquors wholesale and bring them back to the capital. Her whole family helps finish the decoration and preparation of the products for sale. She does this every 15 days since she must travel constantly to fill her orders. Years of working in this business have worn her out and she is thinking of a way to continue working, but in a more relaxed way, because the trips are very tiring. In the future, she wishes to open a restaurant in her home because she is also talented in cooking, especially baking. GracieL. studied cooking and she knows how to make a profitable business out of this skill. With much effort and responsibility, GracieL. began to work with MFP where, along with the communal bank, she was able to take advantage of many opportunities and had the chance to grow. Additionally, the other female members who do the work and the meetings are entertaining people. The 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she has applied for will allow her to acquire large quantities of bottles of wine to sell them at fairs and festivals in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es una mujer muy empeñosa en las actividades que realiza, sobre todo en su papel de madre, pues junto a su esposo, se desviven por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijos y su pequeña nieta, quien llena de alegría su hogar. El deseo de forjar un negocio sostenible, la motivaron desde joven, al contraer matrimonio empezó a vender en los mercados carne de pollo y verduras. Supo ahorrar en tiempos de abundancia y ahora instaló una tienda, la cual ayuda en los gastos de su hogar. De esta forma apoya a su esposo en los gastos de educación para sus hijos, quienes aprovechan la oportunidad que les brindan sus padres. Hace ocho años que viene funcionando su tiendaa, ya tiene clientes fieles, quienes se han convertido en amigos de la familia, y por ellos tratan de abastecer su negocio con productos  de calidad y de módicos precios para que no pierdan a su clientela. Por ellos Luisa desea ampliar su tienda y convertirla en un bazar, donde pueda ofrecer otros productos variados. Este es su préstamo número 29 con MFP, y en todo este tiempo el trabajo con sus compañeras ha sido adecuado, aunque se hayan presentado circunstancias difíciles, pero juntas han ido superando y aprendiendo de ellas. La inversión que tiene que hacer es la compra de mercadería y de vitrinas, indispensables para atraer al público, el costo será de 3200 soles.
texts.en:
Luisa is a woman who works very hard at everything she does but most of all in her role as a mother. She and her husband are completely devoted to their four children and their little grand-daughter who fills their home with happiness. The desire to build up a sustainable business has driven her since she was young, and when she got married she began to sell chicken and vegetables in the markets. She knew enough to save up her money when times were good and now she has set up a store, which helps out with the household expenses. In this way she helps out her husband with the costs of educating their children, who are taking advantage of the opportunity provided by their parents. Luisa has been running her store for eight years. Now she has regular customers who have also become friends of the family and she tries to keep her store stocked with quality products for them at reasonable prices so that she doesn't lose her customers. Luisa wants to expand her store for them and make it into a bazaar where she would be able to offer a variety of other products. This is her 29th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and in all this time her work with her associates has been acceptable. Although they have faced difficult circumstances, together they have been able to overcome them and learn from them. The investment she needs to make is for the purchase of merchandise and display cases necessary to attract the public. The cost will be 3,200 Sols.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixtures and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba M., 61 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre du bois mort. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diénaba M., 61, is married and responsible for 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for 7 and a half years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling dead wood. She wants to bolster her business and improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of firewood

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años, soltera, es una mujer colaboradora, y vivir junto a sus padres le ayuda a desarrollar mejor sus habilidades. Desde que se involucró en el  negocio de su padre fue adquiriendo conocimientos y práctica en administración de negocios, lo que con el tiempo fue perfilando su futura labor, ahora es quien administra la empresa de construcción de su padre. Sin embargo, con la intención de tener recursos propios compró un auto, el cual alquila todos los días para hacer el servicio de taxi, pero corre el riesgo de que las personas no le den un buen uso, perjudicando el funcionamiento del auto. Es por ello, que con el tiempo, desea tener el dinero necesario para invertirlo en la empresa familiar y tener un camión adecuado para el trasporte de los materiales necesarios. Rosa se encuentra trabajando con MFP más de 4 años, donde trata de aprovechar el tiempo que pasa con la socias para confraternizar, para ampliar sus redes sociales. En este momento, le es muy importante el mantenimiento de su vehículo y para ello invertirá los 3000 soles que solicita.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34, single, and very collaborative. She lives with her parents who help her develop her skills. Ever since she became involved in her father’s business she has been acquiring knowledge and experience in business administration. With time this was shaping her future work. Now she is the one who administers her father’s construction business. However, with the intent of having her own resources, she bought a car. She rents the car every day for use as a taxi. But, she runs the risk that the renter will not take good care and will damage the car. For this reason, with time, she would like to have enough money to invest in the family business. She would like to have a truck to transport the necessary materials. Rosa has been working with MFP for more than 4 years. She tries to take advantage of the time she spends with members by being friendly in order to expand her social network. She will use the loan of $975 (3000 PEN) for the maintenance of her vehicle which is very important to her right now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her car

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, casi siempre anda en busca de nuevas oportunidades de negocio, pues gracias a su capacidad para las ventas, tuvo la manera de conseguir una casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo, con la finalidad de brindar a sus dos hijos un techo donde habitar. Rosa instaló un pequeño puesto de comida en la puerta del colegio que se encuentra cerca de su domicilio, pues los niños y los padres de familia son sus clientes más frecuentes, y ella aprovecha esta conglomeración de personas para ofrecer los deliciosos menús económicos para que degusten las personas, también ofrece dulces a los niños en las horas de sus refrigerios durante el día de escuela. Esta labor la mantiene ocupada todos los días, pero los fines de semana, vende en el mercado, pues ayuda a una señora en la preparación de grandes cantidades de comida. Rosa está segura que mientras va aprendiendo la forma de trabajo de su  jefa, tendrá con el tiempo la posibilidad de instalar un puesto propio en el mercado, donde pueda vender en mayores cantidades, siendo esta su ambición a futuro, y por ello trabaja  diariamente. Rosa viene trabajando con MFP hace 10 años, ha recibido 27 créditos en todo este tiempo, los que siguen ayudando al crecimiento de su trabajo. Junto a su banco comunal tienen miras de progresar y de ser más unidas cada vez, aunque tienen que superar a las personas que no responden de manera adecuada con los requerimientos, pero con el paso del tiempo se regulan o se retiran, para que el grupo crezca sanamente. Los 3500 soles que ahora solicita están destinados a la compra de un puesto en el mercado y mercadería para su implementación.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hardworking woman, almost always in search of new business opportunities. Thanks to her capability with sales, she had the ability to obtain a house that she bought with a lot of effort, together with her husband, with the purpose of providing their 2 children with a roof to live under.
Rosa installed a small food stand in the entrance of the high school that is located near her home. The students and their parents are her most frequent customers, and she takes advantage of this conglomeration of people to offer delicious, economical menus for the customers to eat. She also offers sweets to the children during their snack hour of the school day.
She attends to her job every day, but during the weekends, she sells in a market, helping a woman in the preparation of large quantities of foods. Rosa is sure that, while she is learning the manner of working from that boss, with time she will have the possibility to install her own stand in the market, where she could sell in larger quantities. This being her future ambition, she works everyday.
Rosa has worked with MFP for 10 years, and she has received 27 credits over this time period, which have continued helping her grow her business. Together, her communal bank has the objective of progressing and being more united each time, even though they have to overcome the people that don’t respond in an adequate manner to the requirements. But over time, those people regulate themselves or retire, so that the group grows healthfully.
The 3500 Soles that she is requesting are destined for the purchase of a stand in the market and the merchandise for it.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a stand for a market and merchandise

loans.name: Aïssetou

texts.fr:
M. Aïssetou est née en 1958 à Nikki une ville historique dans le département du Borgou au nord BENIN. Aïssetou réside à Cotonou depuis 23 ans où elle s’est mariée à BAGRI Kora un employé de la mairie de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Aïssetou a six (6) enfants dont quatre (4) garçons et deux (2) filles, tous scolarisés. Aïssetou vit avec sa famille dans leur propre maison à Kowégbo. Aïssetou vendait de l’igname pilée sur le parc auto de tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Actuellement, Aïssetou vend à domicile des condiments pour la sauce, de l'huile d’arachide et de palme, de maïs en détail, etc. Presque tous les habitants de son quartier viennent s’approvisionner chez Aïssetou. Pour accroître son capital en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Aïssetou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
M. Aïssetou was born in 1958 in Nikki, a historic town in Borgou province in north Benin. Aïssetou has been living in Cotonou for 23 years and she is married to Kora Bagri, an employee of the Townhall of the city of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin.

Aïssetou has six children, four sons and two daughters, all in school. She lives with her family in their own house in Kowégbo. Aïssetou used to sell pounded cocoyams at the parking lot of Tokpa, the international market of Bénin. Presently, she sells out of her home: condiments for stews, peanut oil and palm oil, maize etc. retail. Almost all the inhabitants of her district come to do their shopping at Aïssetou's. In order to increase her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele, Aïssetou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for stews, palm and peanut oil, and sacks of maize

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba Dramé, 40 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 1 an et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour mieux participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba Dramé, 40, is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma in Ziguinchor for a year and a half. Her business is buying and re-selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business so that she can better participate in catering for family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dyed cloth for re-sale

loans.name: María De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús M. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
 Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar la mercancía y así tener más surtido su negocio. 
Ya que una parte del ingreso del negocio es para pagar los estudio a su hija que está a su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Señora María de Jesús M. has been in the business of selling groceries for more than four years now. Her business needs a larger variety of merchandise but at the moment, she doesn't have the money to buy it and re-stock her business. Part of the income from the business pays for her daughter's education, for which she is responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady F. est mariée avec 07enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Khady F. is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Her business is selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business so as to improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth for re-sale

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora María Del Carmen C. le está haciendo falta más mercancía de abarrotes y verduras. Es por eso que solicita un crédito para poder surtir, siendo este la fuente de ingreso mas importante para su familia, y lo último que quisiera es descapitalizar el negocio. 
Los que atienden el comercio son la señora María Del Carmen y su esposo el señor Francisco Hernández, ellos tienen tres hijos, los cuales estudian y necesitan la mejor de las atenciones; para lograrlo piden su colaboración infinita.
texts.en:
Señora María Del Carmen C.'s business needs more merchandise such as groceries and vegetables. That's why she is requesting this loan, so she can stock up. The store is the source of her family's income and they don't want to run down the business. María Del Carmen and her husband, Señor Francisco Hernández, are running the store and they have three small children who still need their attention.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock the store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
E. Fatima est âgée de 21 ans et est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Fatima est mariée à MOUTAIROU Youssouf, coiffeur de profession. Fatima est mère d’une fille de quatre (4) ans qui est en première année du cours primaire. Le couple vit en location à Minontchou un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Fatima vendait des slips et soutiens gorge au marché international de Cotonou. L'activité de Fatima  a péri dans l’incendie qui s’est produite dans le marché en 2005. Actuellement Fatima vend des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dents. Fatima achète des cartons de pâtes dentifrices au NIGERIA un pays frontalier du Bénin. Fatima vend ses produits aux revendeurs ambulants. Fatima sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour accroître son capital afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.   

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Fatima E., 21, comes from Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Fatima is married to Youssouf Moutairou, who is a barber. She is the mother of a daughter aged 4, who is in the first class of primary school. The couple rents an apartment in Minontchou, an outlying district of Coutonou, economic capital of Benin.

Fatima used to sell underwear and bras at the international market of Cotonou. Her business was destroyed in the fire that burned the market in 2005. Presently, Fatima sells toothpaste and toothbrushes. She buys cases of toothpaste in Nigeria, a country which borders Benin. Fatima sells her products to traveling salespeople. She is requesting a loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital so as to better satisfy the demand of her clientele. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cases of toothpaste and toothbrushes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Diémé est mariée avec 01 enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Awa achète et revend  des produits forestiers et des produits de mer(huile de palme, miel, nététou, des huîtres, de la crevette, du poisson séché et du yet. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce.. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa Diémé is married and raising one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Awa buys woodland and ocean produce (palm oil, honey, "nététou"--a spicy seasoning made from a type of seed; oysters, shrimp, dried fish, and "yet"--dried mollusks) for re-sale. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of woodland and ocean produce

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou Dramé 45 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et des bijoux (chaînes plaqués). Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour mieux participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Nafissatou Dramé, 45, is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling dyed cloth and costume jewelry (gold-plated chains). She wants to bolster her business so as to participate better in covering family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dyed cloth and jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel A. is 31 years old, married and father of a young child. He lives with his wife at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. 

Daniel is very hardworking young man who wants to work hard to provide his immediate family with the needed support. Daniel is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts such as radio sets, speakers, transistors, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Accra and sells to his customers at retail prices. 

He is also a hardware dealer who sells items such as paint, net, roofing sheets, etc. Danny, as he is called by his pals, has been in business for eight years now. But he says prices of raw materials have shot up significantly, which is making it difficult to stock his shop. 

He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical, electronic parts and hardware goods. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and television. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to a village bank called "Won som" which means "let all help."

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Married with three children in the community school, Catherine A. is a 39-year-old trader. She lives and does business in Eguase, which is a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. 

She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business six years ago. 

She has a strong customer base that she supplies with the food stuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and this has helped her to do away with middlemen. Through this, Catherine has been very helpful to her family. Out of the maize she also prepares fante kenkey and sells it by the roadside. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains with fish and any gravy or soup. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. 

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food/fuel crisis in the country. She believes she can buy more bags of maize grains with the loan. Catherine belongs to a group called called "Won som" which means "let all help." This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 36 years old. She is a married woman with four children. Three children are in school, while the fourth is a newborn. She lives with her family in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. 

For the past two years, Juliana has been baking bread and other pastries such as cake, doughnuts, etc., to take care of her household in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc., and sells them to her customers. 

She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance; before they come, their orders are ready. She also sells to individuals for their morning breakfast through  house-to-house selling. She says the price of commodities are increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. 

Juliana needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood. She said your assistance would be very welcome. Juliana belongs to a group called called "Won som," which means "let all help". This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Noami

texts.en:
Naomi A. started her trading business seventeen years ago at Eguase, a suburb of Moore where she lives. Naomi prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish, fresh tomatoes, onions, pepper etc. and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots, green pepper etc. in the community. She is now 42 years old and married with four children who are currently in school.

She has been stuck for funds to make business progress due to the economic crisis in the country. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. Naomi belongs to a village bank called 'Won som' which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables like pepper and tomatoes, smoked fishes etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica C. tiene poca que le entregaron su vivienda pero le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de su casa. 
Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo esta construcción ya que tiene tres hijos y quiere la seguridad para ellos.  Ya que ella y su esposo el señor Francisco Rocha trabajan por la mañana, tiene la preocupación que les pueda pasar algo cuando ellos no lleguen a tiempo a su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Veronica C. has very little to spare on fixing up her home, but she needs a wall along the front of her house. That's why she is requesting a loan in order to get the construction started. She has three young children and she wants them to be safe. Since both she and her husband, Señor Francisco Rocha, are working in the morning, she tends to worry about what could happen to the young ones if they aren't able to get back to the house on time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of the house.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana E. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to five kids. Currently, four of her children are in school in the community where they live. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we called 'Kose'. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes, it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school. She treks to Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. With the loan, she believes she can buy more from the farmers and this will prevent her from frequent traveling. She belongs to a village bank called 'Won som' which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr:
L. Sévérine est née le 18 Avril 1979 à Tori agonsa; elle est originaire de missérété un petit village situé à 15 Km de la ville de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Sévérine a laissé l'école après son échec au Certificat d'Aptitude Professionnel en comptabilité. Sévérine est mère de deux garçons: HALIM âgé de sept (7) ans est en première année du cours primaire; et le second enfant âgé de trois (3) ans est à la maternelle. Les charges familiales sont assurées par le mari de Sévérine. Le couple vit à Kowegbo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Après l'abandon de l'école, Sévérine a commencé par aider sa maman dans la vente des boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) à Tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aidée par sa maman, Sévérine a créé son propre étalage de boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) dans le même marché international du BENIN. La majorité des clients de  Sévérine est faite de Nigérians qui achètent ces boissons en gros. Sévérine a besoin de plus d'argent pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Sévérine a aussi pour projet de diversifier son activité vers la vente de tissus. C'est pour toutes ces raisons que Sévérine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sévérine L. was born on April 18 1979 in Tori Agonsa; her roots are in Missérété, a little village situated 15 km from the town of Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Sévérine left off school after she failed her CAP exam in accounting.

Sévérine is the mother of 2 boys, the older, Halim, age 7, is in the first year of primary school; the second child, who is 3 years old, is in pre-school. The family's living expenses are covered by Sévérine's husband. The couple lives in Kowegbo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou.

After leaving school, Sévérine began by helping her mother sell alcoholic beverages (liqueurs) in Tokpa, the international market of Benin. Helped by her mother, Sévérine set up her own display of alcoholic beverages (liqueurs) at that same international market in Benin. The majority of Sévérine's customers are Nigerians, who buy these beverages wholesale. Sévérine needs more money so as to satisfy her customers. Sévérine also has plans to diversify her business toward the sale of cloth. For all these reasons, Sévérine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of alcoholic drinks (liqueurs) and cloth

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. is a 44-year-old trader. She is a married woman and mother of six children, two of whom are schooling while the rest are working. She resides in Eguase, in the central region of Ghana. Araba has been struggling to provide for the needs of her children's education, her greatest desire. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Araba supports her kids through the sale of used clothing and bed sheets, something she has been involved in for the past two years. Selling used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Araba travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She belongs to a village bank called 'Independence' and wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory; however, she normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towels sales. Araba believes this loan will help her save for her children's future and also rent a store for trading as she sells through hawking.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Yawo Amen

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a eu une formation en cuisine, en 2008 il a ouvert son propre cafetariat qu’il a appelé « cafetariat BARRACK », les gens de son quartier viennent manger chez lui les soirs mais souvent il réalise plus de bénéfice les week-ends, son stock de produits de première nécessité pour les activités du cafetariat étant presque épuisé il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  04 boîtes de MILO, 30 boîtes de lait, 02 cartons de spaghetti, 15 plateaux d’œufs et des légumes. Il est marié et a 01 enfants, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a trained cook and in 2008, he opened his own cafeteria that he calls « cafetariat BARRACK ». People in his neighborhood come to eat at his place in the evenings, but he often makes more profit on the weekends. Since his stock of staples for the preparation of meals is almost expended, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 4 tins of Milo (cocoa drink powder), 30 cartons of milk, 2 cases of spaghetti, 15 trays of eggs, and some vegetables. He is married and has one child, and it is this business that allows him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for his cafeteria dishes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 50 years old. She is divorced, with four children. All her children go to school. She lives with her family at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. For the past 23 years, Ama has been baking bread for sale. In spite of the challenges, Ama is making business progress.

She says she gives best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customer’s expectation. But her sales have fallen because of lack of capital to buy raw materials. Ama says prices of commodities are rising, making it difficult to buy more raw materials to make enough bread to meet high daily demand. She says she bakes at most 550 loaves of bread in a day.

Ama needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc. She says assistance would be very welcome. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer M. is 29 years old, married and father of a school-going child. He lives with his family at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Ebenezer is very hardworking and wants to provide for his immediate family. Ebenezer is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts. Professionally, he is an electrician who takes contracts from clients to wire their houses. He is consistent and reliable in his job, and has won many contracts.

At the time we visited him, he had four contracts which are yet to be executed by him and his three workers. He has been an electrician for nine years. He wants the loan to buy materials frequently used for work. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Accra and sells to his customers at retail prices. With the loan, he believes he can be more resourced to expand his areas of work. He says your assistance would be much welcome. Ebenezer belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa W. is 50 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are grown-ups while her last born is in senior high school. She is old but struggling to provide for her family through the proceeds from her business.

Her husband is not that fit to work and earn income to support the household. Though her adult children are independent, they are not supporting her financially. She buys bags of rice to break and sell in smaller sizes. She sells through hawking, that is from house to house.

Things are not easy for her. She would like a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so that she can be much better resourced to rent a store to trade. Her only hope is you. With the loan, she believes she can sell more bags of rice to support the family. Adwoa belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: Adwoa wants to buy bulk supply of cereals like rice.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 44, married and the mother of seven children. Mary lives with her husband and children at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Through hard work, Mary is supporting three of her children in school.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to earn more income to support her other children in school. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Komesse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un marin de formation, mais il n’a pas pu aller très loin dans ce métier, il s’est vite lancé dans le commerce de cartes de recharges, ce commerce marche bien à Lomé car il y a beaucoup de société de téléphonie dans la ville, il arrive à réaliser de bonnes recettes, actuellement son stock a diminué et il n’arrive pas à répondre convenablement à la demande, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 182 cartes TOGOCEL et 450 cartes MOOV. Il est célibataire et c’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il arrive à subvenir à ses charges
texts.en:
This gentleman trained as a sailor, but he did not manage to go far in this trade. He soon began selling rechargeable phone cards. This business is successful in Lomé since there are a lot of telephone companies in the city. He manages to have a good turnover. Presently his stock is diminished and he is not able to keep up with demand. Thus he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 182 TOGOCEL cards and 450 MOOV cards. He is single and it is thanks to this business that he is able to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Cesar es un cliente antiguo de la institución, trabajó con un grupo solidario “los Cumplidos”, se individualiza y ahora solicita su crédito paralelo para  cancelar del saldo en la compra de una movilidad. Vive con su esposa la sra. Julia quien tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Garcilazo de la Vega, popular feria de la ciudad de La Paz, lugar muy comercial. Tienen tres niños en edad escolar, ambos se encargan de los gastos de la casa. Clientes responsables y conocidos por la zona.
texts.en:
Cesar is a longtime client of Emprender. He used to be part of the "Los Cumplidos" group, but now on his own is asking for a loan to finish paying for the purchase of a vehicle. He lives with his wife, Julia, who has a stand on Garcilazo de la Vega Street, in a popular market in La Paz. They have three school-age children and both of them take care of household expenses. They are responsible clients and known in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the balance on a vehicle.
